· Own and/or manage projects designed to improve operational and process efficiency. This will include accessing and analyzing data and working extensively with external teams.
· Use high-level judgment to own our enforcement decisions.
· Flexible to work on case triaging and escalation handling
· The position requires working non-standard hours (no night shifts) including possible Tues-Sat schedule, or rotating weekend coverage.

title: Senior Brand Incident Manager, Selling Partner Abuse
description:
DESCRIPTION
At Amazon we believe that customer trust is of paramount importance to anything we do. To continue building customer trust the Selling Partner Abuse team works with sellers, brands, vendors and customers to identify and prevent infringement of intellectual property (e. g. copyright, trademark, counterfeit) and other abuse in our product catalog.

We are looking for an experienced Program Manager to investigate complex incidents of suspected infringement of intellectual property and other product abuse. You will work closely with brands, sellers and vendors and implement policies, tools and technology innovations to protect customers, to defend intellectual property, to protect brands, and to ensure compliance with Amazon policies.

You will partner with numerous teams at Amazon including Brand Registry, Product Safety, Perfect Order Experience, Selling Partner Performance, Retail and Seller Services. You will interact with Amazon leadership on complex investigations and you will improve the way Amazon protects customers from product abuse.

title: Sr. Transportation Audit & Compliance Manager, DE
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon is the most customer-centric company on earth. We need exceptionally talented, customer-centric, bright, and driven people. We are looking for an organized self-starter to join the Transportation Risk and Compliance (TRC) team at Amazon. This position can be based in multiple locations in Germany. TRC is looking for a high-judgment individual to join us as a Sr. Transportation Audit and Compliance (A&C) Manager to manage a team of highly-competent A&C managers as well as audit Amazon Last-Mile carrier partners’ compliance against contractual and legal requirements, while driving a compliance culture both internally and externally.

We are looking for an individual with proven people management experience, who cares about growing and supporting a team of highly-skilled individuals. The successfully candidate will also have strong audit experience, and be able to apply their expertise to 1) conduct thorough carrier audits across different business models, 2) manage escalations, both internal and external, 3) identify compliance safety, regulatory and reputational risks, and propose risk-mitigation solutions, and 4) deliver detailed audit finding reports for carriers, business teams and senior leadership. The candidate will require exceptional attention to details and strong data-driven mindset and capabilities, but also excellent soft skills for stakeholder management and earning carriers’ trust. Finally, the successful candidate will display good team spirit and autonomy, especially in those all-virtual times.

If you wish to innovate on behalf of customers, are passionate about driving compliance and reducing risks, and desire to make history, come join our team!


Job responsibilities:
· Lead a team of A&C managers, supporting their career growth, work prioritization and planning, goal setting and day-to-day activities
· Manage escalations, from both internal and external sources, and share findings with senior leadership, both in and out of the organization
· Lead continuous improvement projects
· Vet Last-Mile carrier candidates against Amazon policies prior to their onboarding as Amazon partner
· Audit Amazon Last-Mile carrier partners based on the TRC audit workbook, ensuring that they are operating compliantly with contractual, legal, and regulatory requirements
· Provide thorough audit finding reports to senior management and business partners, including highlights, lowlights and recommendations
· Provide precise audit reports to carrier partners with clear finding details and actionable corrective actions wherever required, helping carriers achieve compliance requirements
· Conduct short-notice compliance audits as required with the utmost flexibility and quality standards
· Investigate suspicious carrier activity and behavior that could pose a risk to Amazon, our customers, or others
· Meet individual and team goals with the highest standards and diligence
· Achieve audit productivity and quality standards

title: Workforce Staffing Coordinator (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION

Wir glauben, dass bei Amazon jeder Tag "Day One" ist.


Ein Tag, den ersten Schritt zu tun. Ein Tag, sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen. Und heute könnte der Tag sein, an dem du selbst Teil einer großen Idee wirst. Ein Tag, an dem du deine eigenen Ideen verwirklichen kannst. Bei Amazon zu arbeiten, ist immer wieder aufregend. Ziel von Amazon ist es seit jeher, das kundenorientierteste Unternehmen der Welt zu werden.

Zur Verstärkung unserer Workforce Staffing (WFS) Teams suchen wir einen Workforce Staffing Coordinator - Buchhaltung (m/w/d)




Als Workforce Staffing Coordinator unterstützt du die Anforderungen der Delivery Stations von Amazon. Die Abteilung WFS arbeitet mit externen Personaldienstleistern zusammen, um sicherzustellen, dass das Arbeitskräfteangebot aufgebaut und auf den Bedarf zugeschnitten ist. Der Schwerpunkt der ausgeschriebenen Stelle liegt in der Buchhaltung.


Die Aufgaben:

· Prüfung von eingehenden Rechnungen
· Nachverfolgung von Rechnungen
· Excel Listen Pflege
· Berechnung von Rückstellungen
· Kommunikation mit externen Partnern und Abteilungen

title: Cloud Application Architect
description:
DESCRIPTION
At Amazon Web Services (AWS) we’re hiring highly talented and technical Architects/Engineers to help accelerate our growing Professional Services business. This is an excellent opportunity to join Amazon’s world class technical teams, working with some of the best and brightest engineers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology companies.

Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the customer base and are obsessed about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.

title: Gruppenleiter/Lead (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Unser Amazon Operations Team wächst!


Wenn Du Teil eines Unternehmens werden möchtest, wo du etwas Bedeutendes bewegen kannst, Spaß hast, Erfolge feierst und ein Lächeln auf die Gesichter unserer Kunden zauberst, dann ist diese Stelle die richtige für Dich!

Du bist für die fachliche Führung des operativen Teams verantwortlich und spielst eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Bearbeitung unserer Kundenaufträge. Du arbeitest eng mit deinem Mitarbeiterteam auf der Fläche zusammen, um für reibungslose operative Abläufe an unseren Logistikstandorten zu sorgen. Dazu zählen unsere Logistikzentren, wo die Ware auf Kundenbestellungen wartet, unsere Sortierzentren, die Pakete für die weitere Verteilung an die Zustellungsdienste sortieren, sowie unsere Verteilzentren die für die letzten Kilometer bis zur Haustür des Kunden zuständig sind.

Wir möchten, dass unsere Teams zusammenarbeiten und sich nicht mit dem Status quo zufriedengeben. Jeder Tag ist bei uns anders, was stets für neue Herausforderungen und Abwechslung sorgt!

Du wirst…

· Darauf achten, dass Sicherheitsstandards eingehalten werden und stets auf dem neusten Stand sind und damit eine sichere Arbeitsumgebung schaffen.
· Die Aufgaben während deiner Schichten verteilen und anpassen und in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Schichtleiterteam erste Führungsaufgaben übernehmen.
· Unsere Mitarbeiterteams motivieren und schulen.
· Sicherstellen, dass Kundenbestellungen gemäß unseren Qualitäts- und Sicherheitsstandards bearbeitet werden.
· Durchgängig relevante Informationen und Kennzahlen auswerten und an das Management-Team weitergeben.
· Stunden- und Zeitplänen für die Mitarbeiterteams erstellen.
· Mit internen und externen Kollegen (m/w/d) zusammenarbeiten (z.B. aus dem Bereich HR, Customer Service, Transport).
· Prozesse auswerten, optimieren und Innovationen vorantreiben.

title: EU Senior Engineering Project Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon is seeking an experienced and business oriented EU Senior Engineering Project Manager to lead the planning and execution of highly complex logistic process automation and storage projects for the continued expansion of our EU fulfillment network.

Successful candidates will have Engineering Program and Project Management experience combined with a strong technical problem solving ability. The role will understand all aspects of an Amazon Fulfillment Center while focusing on its automation technologies (conveyance, sortation, robotics) and storage solutions. This individual will be responsible for planning, designing and delivering state-of-the-art material handling systems and innovations while managing internal teams and external contractors in order to successfully launch new Fulfillment Centers and expansions in existing sites. Amazon’s culture encourages an entrepreneurial approach and expects engineers and managers alike to take a high level of ownership in solving complex problems in a fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities:
· End-to-end ownership for large-scale engineering projects (planning, design, installation, commissioning and qualification, launch support)
· Lead critical path items, dive deep on technical details and provide innovative solutions to resolve issues
· Assess and communicate project status, drive escalations on potential risks and delays across multiple teams
· Prepare and conduct weekly standing meetings with internal teams and external vendors/contractors to plan and track deliverables
· Create, submit and track the relevant CAPEX documentation to ensure that all projects are delivered within budget and best overall value
· Lead technical design reviews and propose design solutions for material handling and storage solutions that meet both business needs and global design standards
· Assist in providing equipment specifications and technical support to procurement and other business partners for best value and competition
· Collaborate closely with various internal teams such as World Wide Engineering, Construction, Operations, Reliability Maintenance Engineering, IT and Procurement
· Traveling on average 50% across projects in Europe

title: Senior Program Manager, Public Sector, Europe
description:
DESCRIPTION
Since early 2006, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has delivered cloud computing services to companies of every size and industry. The Europe Public Sector team brings the latest in disruptive cloud computing technologies to organisations working in the Public Sector, including government departments, state-owned companies, educational institutions, the healthcare sector, and non-profit organisations. We help customers build a deeper understanding of hyper-scale cloud technology and application architectures, and we bring the technical, consultative, and implementation skills required to deliver successful outcomes.

This is your opportunity to join the thriving European Public Sector team in a unique and newly created role focused on developing our relationship with an important European partner. You will develop the engagement strategy, and will be accountable for its successful execution including leading the engagements that will span multiple teams and specialisations over the long-term. Internally, you will advocate on behalf of the partner to drive the development of technology and policy in AWS to enhance the impact of the partnership.

AWS Senior Program Managers work on the most complex customer and partner challenges and opportunities. They have a leading role in developing both the strategy and the teams. They combine an informed view of the market and policy landscape with their understanding of emerging technology trends to accelerate innovation.

This role puts you at the intersection of partnerships, technology, and policy, and is be an exciting and challenging career opportunity for experienced program managers used to leading complex strategic engagements in a highly technical environment and wanting to scale their impact.


Responsibilities include:
· Program Management: Assemble and coordinate an engagement team comprised of of individuals from across AWS and the partner organisation, including executive engagements
· Advisory: Be the strategic business representative of AWS in the partner organisation to influence outcomes and help them achieve their objectives.
· Delivery: Define and plan complex integrated work-streams, delivering executive level and detailed status reports that properly communicates progress to a varied AWS audience.
· Business case development: Develop and present the case for ongoing investment into shaping and developing the relationship.
· Feedback: Work with AWS teams including Public Sector leadership, engineering, support, and business teams to convey partner feedback and lessons learned, and represent requirements in AWS prioritisation.
· Training: Educate the partner and their teams on AWS, our delivery framework, and how we constantly develop and iterate our processes and services.

title: Last Mile Logistics Account Coordinator (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
We are Amazon; we pioneer.
Since opening our virtual doors in 1995, we’ve been pushing the boundaries of possible further and further.
Our entire business works hard to delight our customers – from the second an order is placed online to the seamless coordination of that order behind the scenes, we strive to stay agile, fluid and intentional. That can be described in one of our core Leadership Principles, which is Bias for Action. This means that our teams band together, roll up their sleeves, and aren’t content with just standing still. We’re aiming to become the most customer-centric company on Earth.

That’s why we’re seeking an organized DSP Account Coordinator, to join our wider Amazon Logistics team. This role is based in North Rhine-Westphalia.

At Amazon Logistics we focus on the last mile of the delivery: We are continually striving to innovate and provide best in class service with the help of independent third party logistics suppliers in our Delivery Service Provider (DSP) program. You will be responsible for supporting a number of third party Delivery Service Providers in a defined region in Germany with the day to day account coordination, from the initial onboarding process, financial & compliance queries as well as all IT-system related questions. Using your insights and knowledge, you will contribute to further system & process improvements to make the strong cooperation as smooth as possible.

The ideal candidate has first experiences in the transportation/logistics industry or in a similar fast-paced environment as you will be responsible for:
· Proactively coordinating the relationship between third party logistics suppliers and internal stakeholders
· Supporting back office processes and Account Managers with their analysis
· Tracking and preparing performance and quality figures and statistics
· Supporting, executing and improving technical processes e.g. weekly route forecasts
· Monitoring and verifying timely payments to our third party logistics suppliers
· Preparing and processing seasonal payment incentives
· First level contact for internal and external stakeholders
· Demonstrate an ability to work independently with a strong problem-solving passion and service orientation

title: Instructional Designer
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon opened its virtual doors in 1995 and strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything they might want to buy online. The goal of Amazon Logistics is to build a world class last mile operation. Amazon Logistics aims to exceed the expectations of our customers by ensuring that their orders, no matter how large or small, are delivered as quickly, accurately, and cost effectively as possible.

EU Amazon Logistics Learning team seek a Content Design Manager (Senior Instructional Designer) to own the creation and management of content for all associate and manager facing content across the MEU region. The role incumbent will posses a creative, "sleeves rolled up" hands on approach to understand the working environment and develop content catered for all learning types. Candidate will have experience of development software and integrations with learning management systems. Previous track record in successfully designing content in a fast paced manufacturing environment is critical for this role as is the ability to travel across the MEU region as and when required.
The role reports directly to the EU Snr Content Design Manager.

Key Responsibilities:

· Partnering with key regional stakeholders such as Safety, Operations, Process Engineering, Tech, Subject Matter Experts & WW/Local ACES to create content for new and existing process updates / deployments
· Partner with regional In-Station / On-Road / Management Training execution teams to deploy and continuously improve delivered training content
· Working closely with Snr Content Design Manager and Peer regional content designers to adapt project updates from other EU countries in order to expedite change
· Continuous improvement based on business KPIs and content data points such as xAPIs, surveys and assessments
· Lead content development for regional, EU or WW projects to support business initiatives working with Senior Content Design Manager, In addition to supporting the creation of content in English, for EU wide deployment.

title: Praktikant (m/w/d) Legal
description:
DESCRIPTION
Suchen Sie erste Erfahrungen in einem schnelllebigen, innovativen Unternehmen? Schreiben Sie Geschichte in der Rechtsabteilung von Amazon! Werden Sie Teil einer großen Idee und verwirklichen Sie bei uns Ihre eigenen Ansätze. Kommen Sie zu einem Unternehmen, das sich jeden Tag neu erfindet!

Wir suchen Sie für unser Team in der Rechtsabteilung in München als Rechtsreferendar (m/w/d) in der Wahlstation oder als Praktikant (m/w/d).

Ihre Herausforderungen:
· Sie erarbeiten mit einem hohen Maß an Selbstständigkeit praxisorientierte Lösungen zu vielfältigen unternehmensrelevanten Fragestellungen und Projekten in unseren verschiedenen Geschäftsbereichen. Mögliche Themen kommen zum Beispiel aus den Bereichen:
o E-Commerce: von innovativen Projekten für unsere Kunden über Fragen des Verbraucherschutzes und des Vertriebs bis hin zu produktspezifischen Anfragen;
o Digital Content: von Buch über Video-on-Demand und Apps bis hin zu Alexa; und
o Devices: von der Entwicklung und regulatorischen Anforderungen bis hin zu Verpackung und Verkauf.
· Sie erarbeiten rechtliche Analysen zu produktspezifischen Herausforderungen und gehen Meldungen über Rechtsverletzungen in den Bereichen des Urheberrechts, gewerblichen Rechtsschutzes und des Persönlichkeitsrechts nach.
Sie arbeiten nicht im „Back-Office“, sondern im täglichen direkten Kontakt mit unseren internen Businesspartnern, unseren Kunden, mit externen Anwälten und nicht zuletzt mit dem Team unserer Rechtsabteilung und unseren EU Kollegen.

title: Software Development Engineer, Enterprise Workloads
description:
DESCRIPTION
Have you ever wanted to know how Amazon EC2 works? Do you want to help build the next generation of web-scale tools and infrastructure services that enables companies of all sizes run on EC2 ?
AWS Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) Enterprise team is looking for experienced engineers to make EC2 the best place to run enterprise workloads. The selected candidate will play a critical role in design and implementation of strategic services for EC2 to help increase enterprise‘ cloud adoption. You will closely work with various pre-release Amazon technologies and build services that handles large scale, highly available enterprise business applications. As the key member of the engineering team, you will have an influence on our product strategy by helping define the product features, refine system architecture, and spearhead best practices and operational excellence. A commitment to team work, hustle, and strong communication skills (to both business and technical partners) are absolute requirements.

We are looking for a strong Software Development Engineer who is passionate about working in cutting edge technologies, brings deep technical knowledge, and has experience with distributed systems to drive technical design and implement end-end solutions. The ideal candidate is self-starter who is excited to work on cloud scale software both as an individual contributor and technical lead. The candidate has a proven track record of architecting and building software in Go/Java/and/or C# and is excited to do whatever it takes to make new services successful. The selected candidate will play a critical role in design and implementation of strategic services for EC2 to help increase enterprise cloud adoption in general and SAP in particular.


Location: Walldorf, Baden-Württemberg

Primary responsibilities:[gh1]
· Work closely with product management and customers to holistically understand business and user requirements; Continuously improve own products to provide software which users really love to work with
· Break down high level use cases into concrete technical implementation steps and identify the best solution for a given problem
· Responsible for end-to-end feature development from requirements, design and development, test, maintenance and support of software artefacts
· Architecture, design, proof-of-concepts and implement projects end to end with high quality.
· Ability to handle complex projects, large area of scope and complete ownership.
· Communicating with customers, technical teams and defining technical strategy.
· Maintain current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology, always on a look out for new technologies and work with management and development team in bringing new technologies
· Act as an enabler for your teammate

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon’s Browse Platform and Tools Team (part of the Amazon Catalog and Selection Services (ASCS) organization) is looking for a Software Development Engineer to help us make the world’s best product catalog even better. Our high scale distributed systems process hundreds of millions of updates on the billions of products to power the online buying experience for hundreds of millions of Amazon's customers worldwide, so they can find, discover and buy anything they want 24x7x365. Our vision is to build a best-in-class Product Knowledge to power delightful experiences for our customers on Amazon's Retail Website across the globe. We operate on the edge of technical possibilities by maintaining a large product knowledge repository which describes products, their logical groupings and relationships. We leverage the best technology across the industry by using the latest computing technologies from AWS and by pushing the boundaries of distributed system design. We offer a dream opportunity for engineers who want to create reliable and scalable solutions that enable Amazon to create the largest and best possible selection for our customers.

As a Software Development Engineer in the team, you will have the opportunity of solving challenging technical problems and working across multiple engineering teams, UX designers, and an international team of Ontologists/Taxonomists. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and operating massively distributed systems, big data systems and web services. Technologies involved include graph and NoSQL databases, Java, JavaScript, ReactJS, Elastic Computing and more. This role has a number of opportunities for cross-team ownership and cross-organizational technical leadership to create end-to-end solutions. This role will serve as a great opportunity to springboard your career.

title: Global Accounts Representative - German Speaker
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking talented individuals for the Global Accounts team focused on growing business and defining the cloud computing industry in the world’s largest, most strategic, multinational Fortune 100 companies.

AWS, the world’s leading cloud provider, offers cutting-edge cloud solutions that benefit companies of all sizes. We are growing our new Global Accounts Sales team which focuses on helping the world's largest multinational businesses adopt the AWS cloud platform. If you are passionate about the cloud and have the skills, the Global Account
Rep role provides the opportunity sell business-transforming solutions to the world’s biggest and most impactful companies and shape the future of cloud computing.

The Global Account Rep is responsible for growing the AWS footprint within the Global Accounts segment. The ideal candidate will possess both a sales and technical background that enables them to successfully build and maintain relationships, advise customers on AWS cloud solutions, grow AWS usage across a defined set of customers, develop innovative programs, and expand platform adoption to new business units. A successful candidate will work with prospects, customers, partners, Global Account Managers, and internal teams to consistently meet and exceed sales quotas. This is a strategic role with tremendous growth opportunities.

Location: Munich (other locations in Germany can also be discussed)


Roles & Responsibilities
· Collaborate in the development and execution of Global Account strategies
· Maintain a robust sales pipeline within target accounts and track in Salesforce.com
· Create and close opportunities from start to finish – full sales cycle ownership
· Create a high level network for events and follow up, working closely with closed loop marketing
· Work with partners to extend reach & drive adoption
· Break into new lines of business groups within the defined Global Accounts
· Consistently overachieve targets through a customer-obsessed approach
· Manage numerous requests concurrently & strategically
· Work in a team environment with multiple Global Account Managers
· Some travel
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

title: Marketing Manager with Polish - CEE markets
description:
DESCRIPTION

Flexible location - Preferable London or Berlin


Amazon Operations sits at the heart of the Amazon customer experience. We look after everything from the moment a customer clicks buy; to the moment their item is delivered – from desktop to doorstep. We do things on a massive scale – millions of packages pass through the hands of our Associates every year. As a business, we do lots of things to attract, engage, support, motivate and enable the brilliant people who make it all happen. At the forefront of that effort, in Europe, sits our WFS Marketing team – a collective of talented individuals managing the media & marketing strategy, reporting, modelling & analytics, tools & systems. Our goal is attracting hundreds of thousands of associates yearly for various operational business lines (fulfilment centres, transportation, and logistics).

ROLE OVERVIEW
We are looking for a Marketing Manager for CEE markets (Poland, Czech, Slovakia) in EU Workforce Staffing team. This role will report to Head of Marketing CEE and encompass both strategic and operational elements.

Strategically, this role will develop and drive a marketing and media strategies to support Associates hiring in Amazon Fulfilment Centers in CEE. Together with the Head of Marketing CEE you will be building a holistic marketing approach, responding to both brand and growth objectives – ensuring long-term candidates attraction and conversion. You will manage €1M+ budget, and own and report on marketing performance. You will work with Marketing Analytics peers on in-depth campaign data analysis and make recommendations to optimize campaigns results. You will identify internal and external processes’ weaknesses, look for innovations, recommend solutions and work on implementation.

Operationally, this role will lead the execution of defined strategy, partnering with our media and creative agencies and manage end-to-end our branding and recruitment (acquisition) campaigns in CEE markets to deliver against business objectives. You will be responsible for creating campaign plans (including media, creative and content) to attract, engage and convert our target audience across multiple online and offline touchpoints. You will brief external agencies, monitor alignment between campaigns plans and business objectives, and coordinate the media and creative execution – ensuring top-quality campaigns delivery. You will track, assess and report on the results of campaigns, and implement improvements.

title: DE Real Estate Senior Transactions Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon is currently looking to hire an experienced Real Estate Senior Transactions Manager to join the team and play a critical role in supporting all facility and property activity across Amazon's DE Network. This role will preferably be based in Munich, however home office/virtual work is an option. Regular EU travel will be required.

In this role you will ensure the timely completion of new lease transactions including renewals, expansions, terminations, and reconfiguration of existing warehouse space. This encompasses the entire process from working with the local management team in defining the requirements, lease negotiations (business and legal terms), on-site surveys, comparative financial analysis of lease transaction, and project management to affect the end result. Your primary objective in this role is to provide adequate, cost effective storage/operation space for Amazon on the continent given the market conditions working to challenging deadlines and budgetary requirements.


Responsibilities

Manage the deal flow of large, complex existing building leases and build to suit transactions.
Innovate and execute processes and tools to insure the complete cycle from site search through deal execution is completed.
Create, innovate and implement a relevant system of metrics to plan, manage, measure and evaluate performance pertaining to the transaction process.
Communicate expectations, requirements and status of deals to key business partners – both internal and external.
Manage an ever-changing variety of internal initiatives and projects.
Closely collaborate with Amazon operations, legal, finance, treasury, capacity planning, economic development, transportation and engineering groups to deliver highly successful projects.

title: Senior Content Acquisition Executive, CEE region m/f/d
description:
DESCRIPTION
Come build the future of entertainment with us. Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching?

Prime Video is a premium streaming service that offers customers a vast collection of TV shows and movies - all with the ease of finding what they love to watch in one place. We offer customers thousands of popular movies and TV shows from Originals and Exclusive content to exciting live sports events. We also offer our members the opportunity to subscribe to add-on channels which they can cancel at anytime and to rent or buy new release movies and TV box sets on the Prime Video Store. Prime Video is a fast-paced, growth business - available in over 240 countries and territories worldwide. The team works in a dynamic environment where innovating on behalf of our customers is at the heart of everything we do. If this sounds exciting to you, please read on.

You love film and TV, and make it your mission to identify the best possible content to attract, engage and retain our customers. In this role you can use your excellent skill set to help the Content Acquisition Management (CAM) team reach new heights in content excellence. You can apply your deep analytical skills to make the case for a given acquisition, both qualitatively (the ‘what’ and ‘where’ and ‘from who’) and quantitatively (the ‘how’ and ‘when’); not just within our business, but also externally as you ultimately support negotiations with studios and content creators to procure their best content for Prime Video. You will support the team in designing the content selection for the region to the point where you will assess the efficacy of your past recommendations, to inform future acquisition decisions and feed into the larger vision we create as a team. You will be the point of contact and partner of major studios, local producers, distributors, TV network groups and independent content partners. You will have the opportunity to run profound analysis as you uncover data points to prove or disprove your hypothesis. You can use your ability to clearly and concisely communicate thoughts and ideas, both written and verbally, your know how to prioritize and manage expectations with internal clients and external vendors.

You have the opportunity to work in a team with your highly motivated peers in other European territories, exchange best practice and learning from each other.

Responsibilities:
· Execute the content acquisition strategy for certain content categories on Amazon's Prime Video service in Central and Eastern Europe.
· Contribute to all aspects of content licensing/commissioning negotiations, including content selection, financial analysis, forecasting, and technical requirements for US and local film and TV.
· Manage relationships with key content providers/producers.
·Provide suggestions towards acquisition plans, financial metrics and goals for senior management.
· Collaborate with internal teams (e.g., marketing, public relations, finance, operations, etc.) and report to senior stakeholders on performance.
· Use behaviour, usage and consumption data to inform decision-making.
· Work closely with Amazon Video Management to develop new services and product offering.
· Solve time sensitive issues using the range of tools available at Amazon or via your own methodology to improve on our processes.

title: Gruppenleiter (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Ein Amazon Versandmitarbeiter sollte Antrieb, Ehrgeiz und die Leidenschaft mitbringen, unsere Kunden mit einer erstklassigen Amazon Erfahrung zu begeistern.
Wir glauben, dass bei Amazon jeder Tag "Day One" ist.
Ein Tag, den ersten Schritt zu tun. Ein Tag, sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen. Und heute könnte der Tag sein, an dem Sie selbst Teil einer großen Idee werden. Ein Tag, an dem Sie Ihre eigenen Ideen verwirklichen können. Kommen Sie zu einem Unternehmen, das sich jeden Tag neu erfindet. Bei Amazon zu arbeiten, ist immer wieder aufregend.
Seit jeher ist es Ziel von Amazon, das kundenorientierteste Unternehmen der Welt zu werden. Beliefert werden unsere Kunden aus unseren Logistikzentren in ganz Europa.


Gruppenleiter/Lead (m/w)

In dieser Funktion sind Sie für die Personaleinteilung und die Organisation des reibungslosen Arbeitsablaufs eines bestimmten Bereiches zuständig. Neben statistischen Erhebungen, Erkennen und Weiterleiten von Verbesserungsvorschlägen ist die Kommunikation zu Mitarbeitern, Vorgesetzten und den anderen Abteilungen ein wichtiger Teil Ihrer täglichen Arbeit. Als Lead sind Sie vor allem Vorbild für Ihre Mitarbeiter hinsichtlich fachlicher Kenntnisse, sozialem Verhalten, Engagement, Zuverlässigkeit, Arbeitssicherheit und -qualität.
Aufgabenbereich:
• Fachliche Führung eines Teams von Mitarbeitern
• Ständige Weiterentwicklung und Verbesserung des Produktionsablaufs sowie kontinuierliche Prozessüberprüfung in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Vorgesetzten inkl. situativer Problemlösung
• Konstruktive Umsetzung der geplanten Produktion unter Ausschöpfung der höchst möglichen Qualität und Quantität
• Verantwortung für das Produktionsergebnis
• Mitarbeit in der eigenen Abteilung
• Kommunikation und Organisation mit internen und externen Partnern


Hinweis: Ihre Bewerbung ist erst dann vollständig abgeschlossen, wenn Sie auf der letzten Seite den Button "Bewerbung absenden" drücken.

Ein Abbruch und die Wiederaufnahme der Bewerbung sind jederzeit möglich.

Bei gleicher Qualifikation werden Schwerbehinderte bevorzugt behandelt.

title: Program Manager, Logistics Launch and Expansion
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon opened its virtual doors in 1995 and strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything they might want to buy online.

We are seeking an experienced Program Manager to support the EU Network Development. The successful candidate will be part of the team responsible for program managing strategic large scale cross functional launch and expansion projects and new project initiatives. These will include a conception and execution of a number of new sites across the EU. Programs will include partnering with real estate, engineering, IT and other stakeholders to help expand the network of Amazon Logistics nodes in the EU to facilitate the organization’s growth plans, and other cross functional Supply Chain, Transportation, Engineering & Infrastructure initiatives. The work of this team will include facilitation of approval from functional leaders, project prioritization & scheduling and resource allocation efficiently and effectively.
The Amazon Logistics Launch & Expansion team is looking for a Program Manager who wants to create a best-in-class last mile network. Starting from the first ideas where to place a delivery stations all the way to the final launch and handover to operations you are responsible for the entire project cycle of product from start to finish. Be it site selection, volume planning and design, business case and approval loops or project management with a huge group of internal/external stakeholders and partners – you are the one keeping everything together.

· Manage several competing priorities ensuring critical projects remain visible to all stakeholders whilst maintaining a plan for less urgent matters
· Dive deep into various work streams and not be afraid to learn about each stakeholders contribution, challenges
· Write and review business cases using information acquired from various stakeholders
· Prioritize projects with biggest impact on our business, propose and obtain approval from relevant functional leaders, and schedule resources
· Possesses a broad technical background and has the ability to “roll up their sleeves” and jump in if needed, along with managing
· Find practical and simple solutions to complex problems without sacrificing quality or core functionality
· Be comfortable in different roles, sometimes supporting, sometimes leading
· Take accountability while providing status, ask for help, and immediately escalate issues and problems as necessary
· Maintain the overall project schedule that enables the teams to be successful based upon the project milestones and Go-Live
· Interface with all necessary functions within the company

title: Business Development Manager for Medical Imaging Innovation
description:
DESCRIPTION
Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing awareness and adoption of Amazon Web Services in the EMEA Healthcare public sector market? Do you have the business savvy, public sector experience, and technical background necessary to help organizations leverage the cloud to solve problems? Are you passionate about Healthcare? Now, with Amazon Web Services, you have the chance to help our Healthcare customers and partners achieve their objectives through better technology.
Worldwide Public Sector (WWPS) is looking for an accomplished Business Development Manager for Medical Imaging Innovation in EMEA Public Sector team to drive growth strategies for Healthcare in EMEA. As Business Development Manager for Medical Imaging Innovation, you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape the future of healthcare.
In this role, you will own the definition and execution of EMEA strategic co-development projects in the AI/ML medical imaging space with lighthouse customers and partners. In addition, you will drive adoption of AWS in communities of healthcare innovators, researchers, and clinicians as well as drive usage of AWS services and solutions within the healthcare portfolio. You will also develop and execute scaling mechanisms spanning sales, marketing, and partner activities to support account teams in countries within the EMEA region with medical imaging opportunities including workloads such as Research Environments, AI/ML Pipelines, and Multi-omics.
Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

· Identify customer and partners needs and opportunities, prioritize and design solutions to key problems, and develop GTM strategies for EMEA in the area of AI/ML and medical imaging.
· Identify first adopters to incubate art-of-possible cloud solutions, define and own execution of proof-of-concepts, conduct technical and business validation for medical imaging workflows including solutions and services such as Service Workbench on AWS, Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Comprehend Medical, and Amazon Transcribe Medical.
· Own co-development of open source solutions in partnership with strategic customers and partners as well as with AWS solution architecture, prototyping, and engineering teams.
· Grow adoption with lighthouse customers and partners together with local sales teams across EMEA including Academic Medical Centers, Research Organization, Consortia and R&D Departments focused on AI/ML within HCLS companies.
· Own development of scaling programs including partner programs, training and education, marketing and sales enablement including self-service assets for users of builders of AI/ML imaging workloads.


Please note, this role can be based in any of our European locations.

title: Business Development Manager for Enterprise Medical Imaging
description:
DESCRIPTION
Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing awareness and adoption of Amazon Web Services in the EMEA Healthcare public sector market? Do you have the business savvy, public sector experience, and technical background necessary to help organizations leverage the cloud to solve problems? Are you passionate about Healthcare? Now, with Amazon Web Services, you have the chance to help our Healthcare customers and partners achieve their objectives through better technology.

Worldwide Public Sector (WWPS) is looking for an accomplished Business Development Manager for Enterprise Medical Imaging in EMEA Public Sector team to drive growth strategies for Healthcare in EMEA. As Business Development Manager for Enterprise Medical Imaging, you will have the exciting opportunity to help shape the future of healthcare.

In this role, you will be responsible for accelerating the migration of medical imaging data to the cloud and the modernization of Enterprise Imaging solutions using cloud technologies. You will work directly with medical imaging companies and with lighthouse customers and partners to drive adoption of AWS service for medical imaging workloads. In addition, you will work with the AWS Industry Business Unit as well as AWS Service and Engineering teams to improve the AWS offerings for medical imaging workloads. You will also develop and execute scaling mechanism spanning sales, marketing, and partner activities to support account teams in countries within the EMEA region.

Responsibilities
· Work directly with medical imaging companies to help accelerate the migration of medical imaging data to the cloud and the modernization of Enterprise Imaging solutions using cloud technologies as well as develop GTM strategies for the EMEA region.
· Identify opportunities for cloud-enabled medical imaging workloads within EMEA and own execution of proof of concepts in close alignment with healthcare providers, medical imaging companies, and AWS local teams.
· Understand customers and partners needs and opportunities including security and compliance, technical, operational, and financials aspects, and work closely with the AWS Industry Business Unit as well as AWS Service and Engineering teams to improve the AWS offerings for medical imaging workloads.
· Own development of scaling programs including partner programs, training and education, marketing and sales enablement including self-service assets for users and builders of medical imaging workloads.

title: Customer Service Program Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. Customer Service is at the heart of what we do. Are you interested in joining our acclaimed Amazon's Customer Service team to help shape the future of Amazon Customer Service in EUCS Expansions team, supporting The Netherlands, Sweden, Poland and Turkey, , reporting directly to the Senior Manager, EUCS Expansions and being involved in some of the most exciting initiatives for our employees and customers?

This is a role focused on leading strategic and / or critical programs that will support Customer Service strategy and vision. In this role, you will be managing major, high impact Customer Service cross-functional programmes in a multi-cultural environment that directly impact our customer and employee experience. You will need to find innovative and highly effective ways of working in the EU Customer Service organization. This role is critical in transforming the business to enable sustainable, scalable growth with solutions that delight our internal and external customers.

For this relatively new role, we are looking for someone who is a self-starter, outcome focused and can deliver in an ambiguous environment. This person needs to be a talented Strategic Project/Program Manager who can prioritize well, communicate clearly and has a consistent track record of successful project delivery including creating new processes, implementing change and managing complex projects with often conflicting requirements. Proven ability to manage, influence, and engage a broad group of stakeholders is a must. You must have the experience and capability to create and present documentation for senior executives and align your plans with Amazon’s strategic objectives. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential. You should be experienced in working with data to analyze root causes, implementing long term solutions, and leading teams with advanced analytical, mathematical, and quantitative capabilities.

Responsibilities include:

· Lead strategic and / or critical programs that will support Customer Service strategy and vision
· Represent projects that require a single threaded owner outside the existing program areas.
· Gatekeeper and owner of the CS business plan and keeps the team on track for delivery.
· Own documents for programs and ensure this supports decision-making meetings to get to the right outcomes.
· Attend business/program review meetings, provide feedback and ask questions on areas that stand out.
· Ensure strong follow-up management on action items and questions.
· Act as consultant to various internal teams or projects. Support teams needing help thinking through problems.
· Develop mechanisms to drive best practice sharing across programs and OUs.
· Surface and investigate adhoc new ideas. Drive pilot initiatives and deliver recommendations on top priority items.
· Regular meetings with other PMs across EUCS to bring alignment and consistency.
· Coordinate across EU countries to produce consolidated documents to be presented to leadership teams and drive the creation of content for executive presentations.

title: Senior Account Manager - State-owned Enterprises - Germany, Public Sector
description:
DESCRIPTION

As a Public Sector Senior Account Manager for State-owned Enterprises (SOE), you are driving digital transformations through effective engagement with C-level executives, business development executives, IT leaders, architects, developers, and various lines of businesses. You are establishing Amazon Web Services as the key cloud technology provider across the strategic accounts you manage, promoting the entire AWS products and services portfolio to Enterprise Customers.
On a daily basis you empower your customers to solve challenges while attaining both their operational and innovation goals. You deliver business outcomes while guiding them to become more agile, innovative, and efficient. With AWS, our customers benefit from the fastest pace of innovation, the broadest and deepest functionality, the most secure computing environment, and the most proven operational expertise.


Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact?
Come build the future with us.


Location: The role should ideally be based Munich or Berlin. Other AWS offices and work-from-home options are available.


Roles & Responsibilities


· Develop and execute against a comprehensive account/territory plan for state-owned enterprise accounts (e.g. Utilities, Transportation, Energy, Finance)
·
· Create & articulate compelling value propositions around AWS services
·
· Create & maintain an opportunity pipeline and drive consistent account-specific activities
·
· Work with partners to extend reach & promote adoption
·
· Manage complex customer interactions
·
· Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts
·
· Ensure customer satisfaction
·
· Expect moderate travel

title: Regional Safety Manager Germany - Amazon Air
description:
DESCRIPTION
Here at Amazon we are currently looking for a Senior Workplace Health & Safety (WHS) Manager to join the team and play a critical role in supervising the health and safety within Amazon Air Operations. The ideal candidate will identify, coordinate and guide improvements in operations safety, quality and productivity, working with the Operations Management teams to continuously improve the functionality and level of service that the site provides to our customers.

Responsibilities
You will be coordinating aspects of output in your area: people management, metrics, productivity targets, and process improvements. The extent of your tasks will include:
· Supervising the health and safety function in the site, including supervision of staff to ensure delivery of goals.
· Providing authoritative advice and guidance on health & safety matters to all stakeholders within designated area of responsibility.
· Reviewing and auditing arrangements for health & safety management and continuously improving these arrangements where appropriate.
· Providing strategies to plan and organize work systems to reduce health & safety risks and recommending suitable adaptations to plant, machinery and processes.
· Ensure robust reporting regimes are in place for H&S statistics.
· Providing management information and statistics related to your area of responsibility.
· Supporting business change through effective change management processes within the growing environment.
· Propelling behavioral culture change program across a large, complex, multi shift operation.
· Implementation and review of company global safety policies ensuring that local legislative requirements are also met.
· Manage risks and opportunities in a air transport environment.

title: Data Scientist - AWS Fraud Prevention
description:
DESCRIPTION
Would you like to join the team that protects the global AWS platform from fraud? Do you enjoy thinking like a fraudster and using your technical skills to help detect & mitigate AWS accounts from being compromised? If so, AWS Fraud Prevention has an exciting opportunity for you.

AWS has the most services and more features within those services, than any other cloud provider–from infrastructure technologies like compute, storage, and databases–to emerging technologies, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, data lakes and analytics, and Internet of Things. AWS Platform is the glue that holds the AWS ecosystem together. Whether its Identity features such as access management and sign on, cryptography, console, builder & developer tools, and even projects like automating all of our contractual billing systems, AWS Platform is always innovating with the customer in mind. The AWS Platform team sustains over 750 million transactions per second.

The AWS Fraud Prevention Compromise vertical is responsible for detecting & mitigating AWS account compromise. You’ll be part of a team of Data Scientists, Investigations Analysts, and Technical & non-Technical Program Managers. The team’s goal is to identify and neutralize fraudsters from compromising AWS customers’ accounts.

As a Data Scientist, you will work directly with Business Analysts and Software Development Engineers to monitor the flavor/ trend of compromise on AWS worldwide and design appropriate solutions to respond in a collaborative environment. There are no walls, and success is determined by your ability to dive deep, and understand the subtle demands new and complex services will place upon systems and teams.

As a Data Scientist your responsibilities will include:
· Apply state-of-the-art Machine Learning methods to large amounts of data from different sources to build and productionalize fraud prevention, detection and mitigation solutions
· Deep dive on the problems using SQL and scripting languages like Python/R to drive short term and long term solutions leveraging Statistical Analysis
· Analyze data (past customer behavior, sales inputs, and other sources) to figure out trends, create compromise prevention and mitigation solutions and output reports with clear recommendations
· Collaborate closely with the development team to recommend and build innovations based on Data Science
· Manage your own process: identify and execute on high impact projects, triage external requests, and make sure you bring projects to conclusion in time for the results to be useful

Learn and Be Curious. We have a formal mentor search application that lets you find a mentor that works best for you based on location, job family, job level etc. Your manager can also help you find a mentor or two, because two is better than one. In addition to formal mentors, we work and train together so that we are always learning from one another, and we celebrate and support the career progression of our team members.

Inclusion and Diversity. Our team is diverse! We drive towards an inclusive culture and work environment. We are intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. Team members are active in Amazon’s 10+ affinity groups, sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. These range from groups such as the Black Employee Network, Latinos at Amazon, Indigenous at Amazon, Families at Amazon, Amazon Women and Engineering, LGBTQ+, Warriors at Amazon (Military), Amazon People With Disabilities, and more.

Learn more about Amazon on our Day 1 Blog: https://blog.aboutamazon.com

title: Senior Technical Account Manager (EMEA)
description:
DESCRIPTION
At Amazon, our vision is to be earth’s most customer-centric company. In 2006, we launched Amazon Web Services, giving customers access to the same cloud technology we built to serve millions of shoppers on Amazon.com. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a secure cloud services platform, offering computing power, database storage, content delivery, and other functionality to help businesses scale and grow. Millions of businesses are using AWS cloud solutions to build sophisticated applications with increased flexibility, scalability and reliability.

The Role

As a trusted advisor you’ll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. You’ll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services. This includes a range of products including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT and many more. Our Technical Account Managers partner with some of the most iconic businesses in the country. These range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation. You’ll provide advice on architecture, support strategy, project, and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues.
Here you can find what a day in the life of a TAM looks like from our very own TAMS:
· https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-ahmed-technical-account-manager
· https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-joseph-technical-account-manager
· https://emea-resources.awscloud.com/write-your-own-story/meet-imane-sr-technical-account-manager

Responsibilities include:-
· You’ll build solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
· Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
· Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
· Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
· Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
· Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
· With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
· Provide detailed reviews of service disruptions, metrics, detailed pre-launch planning
· Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
· Uplift customer capabilities by running workshops, brown bag sessions, etc.

As we continue to rapidly expand in EMEA, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to develop your technical, consulting and leadership skills. You’ll work with talented cloud technologists whilst expanding your knowledge of AWS products. You’ll also have the chance to receive mentor-ship and gain AWS certifications.

Do you want to be part of history and transform businesses through cloud computing adoption? We would love to hear from you.
