title: Front End Engineer - AWS, IoT DPP
description:
DESCRIPTION
Do you want to build new things to help change the face of IIoT manufacturing? We work with Volkswagen, our customer, on building a Digital Production Platform.
We build software in close collaboration with our customer for the customer’s environment. Join our diverse and cross-functional team and be part of this adventure.
As a member of our team you will have significant impact on the product. You get the opportunity to work with smart teams of our customer. You will work with a modern tech stack solving hard engineering problems at scale.

title: Senior Program Manager Operations Excellence
description:
DESCRIPTION
About Amazon
At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Amazon is one of the most recognizable brand names in the world and we distribute millions of products each year to our loyal customers.

AMXL Operations
Amazon Extra Large (AMXL), formerly known as Special Handling, obsesses over customers by offering a white glove service where we deliver TVs and other large items like furniture in customers’ homes. Not only do we deliver large parcels, we unpack, assemble, install and sometimes even do tests, hauling away old items as needed. We are currently in the process of building out a network that is poised for big growth in the coming years. Check out a recent story that showcase what makes AMXL so unique.

The Role
As a Senior Program Manager Operations Excellence you will be part of a AMXL 3PL Operations team that is entrepreneurial, diverse and highly collaborative. You are a hands-on leader that works alongside stakeholders in field operations, program managers, business owners, and tech teams to define new operational requirements, drive feature roadmaps, and implement process changes. You are passionate about operational excellence and customer service. You possess strong attention to detail, ability to quickly prioritize tasks, willingness to learn new things, and a commitment to delight our customers. You feel confident analysing data and make sound recommendations in an often ambiguous environment. The role will require exceptional communication skills and the ability to influence change at all levels by influencing without authority, working in ambiguous spaces, and presenting your findings to multiple stakeholders.
You execute methodically by identifying gaps and driving effective solutions that scale over time. This position requires a candidate with the proven ability to drive projects to completion, manage costs and risks, implement process improvements and ability to work at pace to push for our continuous improvement while motivating others to meet challenges in a deadline-driven environment.

Key Job Elements:
· Work independently and as part of a team in an ambiguous environment to understand & solve business problems
· Gather and analyse data and best practices to benchmark new standards for operations while identifying, mitigating or eliminating root cause issues within current systems to ensure successful, cost effective and continuous operations that can scale
· Define, identify and document best practices into accessible SOPs, standard work checklists, and other relevant materials needed to support the AMXL 3PL teams
· Scope, create and manage cross-functional projects that drive results while maintaining alignment with internal stakeholders
· Own program status and risk communication, harmonize discordant views, and lead the resolution of contentious issues (build consensus) by collaborating with internal customers to determine projects priority and outcome
· Collaborate and oversee new AMXL 3PL launches to drive the effective integration and adoption of processes and ways of working
· Convey direction to all levels within the organisation and senior leadership through excellent communications and presentation skills

This is an opportunity to build and scale the AMXL 3PL Operations Excellence team in an environment of extraordinary growth. Top candidates will excel at driving results in a fast-paced, ambiguous, and rapidly scaling environment, and will combine attention to detail with a knack for thinking big and inventing new solutions. Earning trust and working through influence will be critical to drive impact across multiple stakeholders and partners.

title: Program Manager, Amazon Extra Large - Last Mile/Transportation
description:
DESCRIPTION
At Amazon, we're working to be the most Customer-centric company on earth. One customer experience that we’re constantly looking to take to a new level is how we fulfill and deliver customer orders. Amazon aims to exceed the expectations of our customers by ensuring that their orders, no matter how large or small, are delivered as quickly, accurately, and as cost effectively as possible. Amazon is seeking an exceptional Program Manager who will be part of a start-up group that’s defining and building cutting-edge products and service capabilities supporting Amazon’s current and future delivery initiatives. Come join the team and help us make history!

As Program Manager, Amazon Extra Large (AMXL) you will be responsible for managing significant operational processes across our European operations. You will be implementing standardized process and quality for our Amazon two-person / special handling delivery service “AMXL”. To be successful in this position, you need to be comfortable driving operational projects in a high pressure and often ambiguous work environment and interfacing with various functional teams and individuals at all levels of the organization. This role will include a mix of operational projects and short term tactical tasks. The ideal candidate has a broad skill set including excellent business judgment, deep curiosity about how things work, strong written and oral communication skills and a passion for creating effective processes and mechanisms that scale.

Key responsibilities include:
· Deliver a comprehensive analytics capability to forensically investigate our processes, operations and technical systems, providing detailed, data-driven insight to shape our program and operational decisions
· Working with engineering, supply chain and operations stakeholders to evaluate and support business decisions in an ambiguous environment
· Designing program mechanisms to reduce bottlenecks, improve communication, identify risks, and gather feedback from a wide range of worldwide stakeholders
· Develop regular program communication, including launch plans, timelines, status updates, post-launch assessments and performance reviews
· Rolling up your sleeves to help get things done: we’re in expansion mode!
· Proactively build and manage relationships with key internal stakeholders across a range of businesses

Location is relatively flexible on this role and it could also be based in Germany, Spain or UK.

This role is part of the Worldwide AMXL Program which is an initiative designed to help Amazon improve and expand the delivery of large items and those requiring special handling and additional services for exceptional customer experience. The target is to grow this business in EU with excellent customer experience and cost position. This Program Manager will be a resourceful and confident team player who can think out of the box in an ambiguous problem space, and is willing to roll up their sleeves to build a program that will significantly impact Amazon’s last mile delivery capabilities globally.

title: Customer Solutions Analyst
description:
DESCRIPTION
At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history.
As a Customer Solutions Advisor for the OpsTechIT Supply Chain Operations Customer Service Team, you will own customer fulfillment, utilizing various tools and methods at the disposal of the team. This role is in a very fast paced environment with quickly changing customer needs and priorities. A successful team member needs to be able to respond quickly, communicate timely and follow up often. The work being performed in this role will span multiple teams and organizations as we work with our customers to define, accept and fulfill their needs and requests.

Key Responsibilities:
· Daily receipt, triage and management of trouble ticket requests.
· Daily engagement with various supply chain internal teams to enable the triage and management of customer requests and work.
· Daily engagement with customers external to supply chain to enable accurate receipt of work requests to ensure we are providing the best customer experience possible.

title: Manager Studio Operations (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon sucht einen talentierten Manager Studio Operations (m/w/d), um das Studio Operations Team in Rahmen unseres kommerziellen Fotostudios zu führen.
Als Manager Studio Operations (m/w/d) leitest Du den Arbeitsablauf aller zu fotografierenden Produkte im Studio. Du legst Produktionsziele fest, sicherst die Bereitstellung ausreichender Resourcen und koordinierst die Teams, um eine reibungslose Planung der Produktion sicherzustellen. Als Führungskraft im Studio, sorgst Du für die Einhaltung der Arbeitsvorgaben, identifizierst Ineffizienzen und treibst kontinuirliche Verbeserung unserer Prozesse voran. Du bist verantwortlich für das Reporting der Kennzahlen an Deine Manager. Du stellst stabile Arbeitsabläufe sicher, die auf hohe Produktionsmenge skaliert werden können, während du Dein Team motivierst, die gewünschten Ergebnisse zu erzielen. Die Qualität Deiner Führungsarbeit ist der Schlüssel zum Erfolg in dieser Position.

Dein Aufgabengebiet umfasst:
· Organisation, Management, Kontrolle und Führung des Studioworkflows
· Einhaltung der Sicherheits- und 5S-Vorgaben und Umsetzung von Studioprojekten in diesem Bereich.
· Vorgabe und Einhaltung der täglichen Produktionsziele im Rahmen eines vorgegebenen Planes und gesetzter Fristen
· Sicherstellung einer effizienten Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Abteilungen des Studios
· Erstellen und Analyse von Reportings und Ableiten geeigneter Maßnahmen, um das Erreichen der Produktionsziele sicherzustellen
· Management eines Teams von Operations Mitarbeitern, inklusive deren Betreuung und Weiterentwicklung
· Erarbeiten von Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) und sicherstellen der Umsetzung dieser Prozessvorgaben im Team
· Leitung von Initiativen im Rahmen von Prozessverbesserungen und/oder Studioprojekten inkl. Analysen, Dokumentation und Audits
· Zusammenarbeit mit internationalen Teams, um Prozesse und Standards abzustimmen
Erstellen von Trainingsdokumenten und aktive Unterstützung des Wissensmanagements im Imaging Netzwerk



Amazon is looking for a Manager Studio Operations (m/f/d) to manage our studio operations team in a commercial photography studio environment.
As Manager Studio Operations (m/f/d) you will oversee the workflow of high volumes of products to be imaged. You set daily production goals and ensure resources are in place to meet targets, coordinating teams to ensure seamless planning for product requiring images. As a leader in the studio, you ensure standard operating procedures are followed, identify inefficiencies in workflow and drive continuous improvements. You will be responsible for reporting performance metrics to senior leaders. You deliver solid operating procedures that can scale at high volumes while motivating a team of people to deliver results. The quality of your leadership is the key for success in this role.

Responsibilities include:
· Management of studio workflows
· Abidance of safety and 5S guidelines und execution of projects in this field.
· Providing and meeting daily production targets within the scope of a given plan and defined deadlines
· Ensuring an efficient cooperation with other departments of the studio
· Creating and analyzing reports and derive appropriate measures to achieve production goals
· Management of an operations team including mentoring and development
· Creating standard operating procedures (SOP) and ensure execution within the teams
· Leading process improvement initiatives and/or studio projects including analysis, documentation and audits
· Cooperation with international teams to align on standard processes
· Creating training documents and active support of knowledge management within the Imaging network.

title: HR Program Manager, M&A
description:
DESCRIPTION
*This role can be hosted in any UK or EU Amazon location*

At Amazon, we’re working to be the most customer-centric company on Earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people. If you’d like to help us make history, here’s your chance to accelerate our growth and ability to serve our customers through Global Expansion and Mergers and Acquisitions (GEMA).

The GEMA HR Program Manager for M&A will partner with the internal Amazon HR Centers of Excellence, Business HR Business Partners, Corporate Development Integration Leaders, and acquired leadership teams through all phases of a M&A project. This role will be based in UK, but will have a global scope, supporting acquisitions across all geographies and business lines.

The ideal candidate has a passion for owning and driving process and operational improvement, and a track record of thinking outside the box to deliver innovations on behalf of customers.

The right candidate will possess a hybrid program/project management background with demonstrated experience leading simultaneous initiatives as well as extensive experience across the breadth of Human Resources workstreams. Our team works in a fast-paced, global environment and someone who thrives working on high-profile projects, enjoys travel and is comfortable interacting with a wide range of HR and business professionals across all levels would be well-suited for this role.

Responsibilities Include:
· Help to continuously improve the Global Expansion/M&A program & tools at Amazon by identifying ways to improve the employee or customer experience – via automation, simplification or other types of process improvement; partnering cross-functionally to influence and implement change.
· Provide hands-on support and project management in all HR matters for M&A deals from due diligence through integration phases and ultimately through transition to business HR teams.
· Partner with key HR subject matter experts to deliver solutions for integration issues such as: immigration, recruiting, benefits, compensation, payroll, time and attendance, retirement plans, stock/equity, HR compliance, employee relations, organization design, diversity & inclusion, talent management, and performance management.
· Drive appropriate M&A and country due diligence and integration activities, including job leveling together with other relevant HR functions.
· Provide excellent customer service to all stakeholders by helping to resolve any issues/questions.
· Ensure GEMA tools, best practices and lessons learned are documented and communicated within the internal HR teams.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
DESCRIPTION
The EU Workforce Staffing Analytics team is responsible for our hourly workforce: Who do we hire? How should we hire them? How do we make sure the right candidate gets the right role at the right time, and how do we do this scalable & efficiently? As Amazon moves toward free one day shipping for prime customers, and as we continue to scale, answering these questions will have material impact on the business, and on the experience our candidates have.

Here’s where you come in:
We are looking for a talented EU WFS Business Intel Engineer to help manage our ever-growing data & reporting needs and support analytics of an increasingly complex business related to Workforce Staffing (WFS) across the EU.

As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will generate insights that will guide operational excellence and business strategy for our customers. Data analysis is at the core Amazon’s culture, and your work will have a direct impact on decision making and strategy for our organization. You will be gathering customer insights, mining data, making recommendations, and helping senior leaders make key business decisions. You will have the opportunity to work with large and diverse data sets to gather insights using data from across Amazon Operations.
The ideal candidates will have excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and judgment, intense curiosity, strong technical skills, and superior written and verbal communication skills. They will have a strong bias toward data driven decision making. They will be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big and be creative (while paying careful attention to detail). Enjoys working in a fast-paced dynamic environment. If you are excited about data, are results oriented, and want to join a growing analytics team within Amazon, this role is for you.



Main Responsibilities:
· Be part of a high performing team of Business Intelligence Engineers
· Constantly challenging the status quo and proposing alternative solutions to drive the efficiency
· Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support the needs of the business.
· Apply deep analytic and business intelligence skills to extract meaningful insights and learning from large and complicated data sets.
· Be hands-on with ETL to build data pipeline to support automated reporting.
· Serve as liaison between the business and technical teams to achieve the goal of providing actionable insights into current business performance, and ad hoc investigations to support future improvements or innovations. This will require data gathering and manipulation, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
· Build various data visualizations to tell the story of business trends, patterns, and outliers through rich visualizations.
· Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation.
· Ability to travel; 10%+ travel expected

title: Senior Ecommerce Partner Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION
Come build the future with us! What unites all Amazonians (across teams and geographies) is that we are all striving to delight our customers and make their lives easier. In the pursuit of delighting customers, we have developed many products and services that have transformed the way our customers live their lives and run their businesses. Together we are building the future, one innovative product, service, and idea at a time.

Amazon Advertising is dedicated to driving measurable outcomes for brand advertisers, agencies, authors, and entrepreneurs. Our ad solutions including sponsored, display, video, and custom ads leverage Amazon’s innovations and insights to find, attract, and engage intended audiences throughout their daily journeys. With a range of flexible pricing and buying models, including self-service, managed service, and programmatic ad buying, these solutions help businesses build brand awareness, increase product sales, and more.

As an Ecommerce Partner Manager (EPM), you will be responsible for building and executing the Sponsored Ads and ecommerce partnerships with Holding Companies and Consultancies. This partnership program is designed to up-level the ecommerce proficiency of our largest partners and empower them to help brands holistically with their Ecommerce strategy. The program provides a range of services that help partners connect the dots between Retail, Media and Advertising. You will work across Holding Companies and Consultancies, and will serve as the main point of contact for their ecommerce specialist teams. Your priority will be to work backwards from the agency customer and help them develop best-in-class tools and services on ecommerce and Sponsored Ads.

Key Responsibilities
· In partnership with our Agency Development Team, develop and execute a customer-led strategy for ecommerce growth for media agencies and consultancies. This includes our Sponsored Ads ad product suite as well as our Retail tools.
·
· Evangelize best practices that connect the dots between our Retail, Media and Advertising solutions.
·
· Establish trusted relationships with the eCommerce and Search c-suite across holding companies and consultancies.
·
· Closely work with Marketing to build narratives and insights surrounding eCommerce and Sponsored Ads.
·
· In collaboration with Finance, establish meaningful KPIs to measure success and impact of these partnerships. Regularly audit metrics to continually drive quality of the program and deliver targets.
·
· Contribute to continuous enhancement and innovation within the Ecommerce Partnership Program. This implies the creation of scalable mechanisms enabling measurable impact.

The position can be based in MUC, HH, DUS or BER.

title: Global Account Manager - Renewable Energy
description:
DESCRIPTION
AWS is seeking a world class sales professional to manage our global customer relationship with one of the largest companies in the world.

The Global Account Manager will be responsible for providing global business leadership and management of this global account. You will build and maintain key relationships, develop and manage opportunities, monitor deployment projects and engage virtual resources. You will define a CXO relationship strategy within the account, including engaging with AWS senior leadership team for executive sponsorships, coordinating executive business reviews, and maintaining customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities
The Global Account Manager is responsible for teaming with the customer’s IT Organization to build strategic relationships across the account, articulating a clear vision and generating enthusiasm, while impacting all business groups. The rep is responsible for selling at the most strategic level within the account and implementing a broad strategy for earning customer acceptance and service implementation. The rep will work with all appropriate AWS resources (Executives, Solution Architects, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, Support, Service teams and Professional Services) to support customer interests. This includes dotted line responsibility for downstream sales and technical resources that may be geographically distributed.

Development of formal case studies and other forms of references highlighting activity and workloads running on AWS is core to the role.

title: Senior Vendor Manager BWS (part-time)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Come built the future with us!

Ever since Amazon opened its virtual doors, our aim has been to become the most customer-centric company in the world. How? By having people like you who make sure that our customers can find everything that they are looking for online – at great value and convenience. Immerse yourself in an environment that is fast-paced, growing and continuously innovating to offer great opportunities for our customers and for you!
We encourage an entrepreneurial environment where ideas are valued, respected and implemented quickly. Our aim is to offer customers more choice and the fastest delivery at great value.

Amazon is looking for a talented, team-oriented, driven and highly analytical Senior Vendor Manager in part-time (20-29h) for the DE Alcoholic Beverages business based in Munich.

Responsibilities:
· Own category and vendor management strategy and execution for the alcoholic beverages category
· Build strong and sustainable relationships at an executive level with our vendors (in DE and across EU), drive strategic negotiations for improved costs and terms and facilitate discussions in order to drive profitable growth
· Stay on top of industry and competitive trends, and execute at both a tactical and strategic level to increase customer experience as well as drive selection, sales and margin growth.
· Identify potential brand and product business opportunities and manage multiple responsibilities across EU team within a fast-paced environment
· Drive category performance and sales and margin improvement by translating category metrics into actionable plans
· Seek out ways to automate and simplify manual processes in order to improve productivity
· Share best practice across categories, also contributing to the international know how

title: Senior Vendor Manager Grocery
description:
DESCRIPTION

Come build the future with us
Ever since Amazon opened its virtual doors, it aims at becoming the most customer-centric company in the world. How? By having people like you who make sure that customers can find everything that they are looking for online – at great prices and convenience. Immerse yourself in an environment that is fast-paced, expanding, continuously innovating and offering great opportunity for our customers and for you!


Amazon is looking for a smart, team-oriented, highly analytical leader to join our Grocery business as Senior Vendor Manager based in Munich.

This is how you can contribute to our success:
· Work on the vendor management strategy
· Build strong and sustainable relationships at an executive level with our vendors. Find creative solutions in negotiations and facilitate discussions in order to drive profitable growth
· As a leader within the business you will share best practice across categories, also contributing to the international know how
· Turn in-depth analysis into strategic insight, present these in convincing figures and turn them into action
· Seek out ways to automate and simplify manual processes in order to improve productivity

title: Manager Security & Investigation
description:
DESCRIPTION
Do you have a Bias for Action?

Would you rather work for the disrupter, or the disrupted?

Are you up for creating solutions and solving tomorrow’s problems today?

We’re glad to hear it.

Since opening in 1995, we’ve been pushing the boundaries of possible further and further. Today, we’re a Fortune 500 organization that relies on Amazon’s security systems and World Wide Loss Prevention Programs, especially in the ever-growing environments of our Fulfillment Centers (FCs).

These FCs are at the heart of our rapidly growing business: they’re where we coordinate a vast range of our fast-moving inventory. Our FC teams stow deliveries, pick products, package them up and ship them out: each of these groups have played their part in taking us where we are today.

You’ll join an FC as a member of the senior management team, where you’ll supervise, coordinate and implement all aspects of our loss prevention strategy.

Your mission:

The main areas of focus for you will include:
● Loss exposure and loss controls analysis,
● Loss investigation, and when necessary, theft investigation,
● Physical security systems and controls,
● Contracting guard services,
● Loss prevention education and awareness,
● Thorough loss prevention audit programs.


Day-to-day responsibilities:

Therefore, you’ll understand the critical importance you will play in your FC’s Loss Prevention Program. Alongside the above points, you will manage and guide your FC’s process of compliance with all corporate loss prevention standards:
● Effectively partner with operations and support functions, in evaluating current and future business processes and initiatives,
● You’ll identify, develop and implement additional loss prevention strategies to meet the unique needs of your assigned FC,
● Function as part of a team of Loss Prevention Managers: together you’ll effectively pursue improvements to company-wide loss prevention efforts,
● Perform interior and exterior loss prevention audits of your FC and off-site facilities, while effectively dealing with any kind of security issue that is raised,
● Monitor your Fulfillment Center in terms of ongoing compliance with any and all company security policies,
● Perform various loss prevention inspections, audits, and investigations as required,
● Encourage and promote loss prevention within the workforce, by exercising integrity and ethical methods,
● Positively represent the Amazon Security/Loss Prevention department through public relations and customer service; set a personal example of the highest level,
● Demonstrate knowledge of FC best practices at loss prevention, such as:
○ The application of physical security systems,
○ The investigation techniques and laws of arrest,
○ The management of contract guard agencies,
○ Effective transportation/supply chain loss mitigation techniques,
● Conduct new hire orientation and training in your loss prevention strategy,
● Be able to work and travel as and when required by business need.
