· Du untersuchst Unfälle, Beinahe-Unfälle und alle weiteren Vorfälle während der Ursachenanalyse.
· Du aktualisierst interne Datensätze zu Unfällen, Beinahe-Unfällen und sonstigen Vorfällen.
· Du erstellst Maßnahmenpläne für eine kontinuierliche und nachhaltige Einhaltung der Rechtsvorschriften.
· Du verhältst Dich jederzeit professionell und behandelst Angelegenheiten, die Sicherheitsuntersuchungen nach sich ziehen, vertraulich.
· Flexibilität: Du bist bereit und in der Lage, zu Spitzenzeiten in unkonventionellen Schichten, einschließlich am Wochenende und nachts, zu arbeiten.

title: Kernel/Hypervisor Engineer
description:
DESCRIPTION
As an organization, we believe in making a big difference in people’s lives. We do so by building ground technology that enables innovation to solve complex challenges. We engineer pioneering virtualization software that serves as the foundation to driving innovation efficiently, and nimbly. We influence the different layers of the stack, while attentively listening to customer input.

EC2 Accelerated Nitro is the organization that drives the engineering parts of the EC2 Accelerated Computing business, and that crafts and releases the hypervisors that power the EC2 Nitro fleet. We build highly operable quiescent software that provides near bare metal performance to EC2 instances. We also integrate hardware accelerators (GPUs, FPGAs, etc.) into the EC2 instance families to support advanced workloads, such as machine learning, high performance computing, inference or graphics processing.

EC2 Accelerated Nitro is looking for a Software Development Engineer to work on the system software at the core of EC2, the AWS service that provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud. You will have the chance to make a significant impact on our systems, our business and, most importantly, our customers.

With solid software engineering knowledge, and interest to grow in the virtualization space, you will partner up with expert engineers of the field, and make a real difference in the world, building solutions to challenging problems that affect millions of people.

title: Senior Operations Manager (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION

Please submit your CV in English only.

Amazon leistet Pionierarbeit.
Seit den ersten Anfängen im Jahre 1995 haben wir die Grenzen des Möglichen immer wieder neu erfunden.

Das oberste Ziel unseres Unternehmens ist die Zufriedenheit unserer Kunden. Vom Moment der Online-Bestellung bis zur reibungslosen Koordination dieser Bestellung hinter den Kulissen wollen wir stets flexibel, agil und zielgerichtet auftreten. Daher lautet eines unserer zentralen Führungsprinzipien "Im Zweifel: Handeln"! Wir möchten, dass unsere Teams zusammenarbeiten, die Dinge anpacken und sich nicht mit dem Status quo zufriedengeben. Es ist unser Ziel, das kundenfreundlichste Unternehmen der Welt aufzubauen.

Daher suchen wir derzeit einen Senior Operations Manager (m/w/d) für unser FC in Osterweddingen bei Magdeburg, eine Schlüsselposition im Amazon Logistikteam. Die Mitarbeiter in diesem Team sind verantwortlich für die Optimierung unseres Transport-, Sortierungs- und Liefernetzwerks. Sie setzen Ihre Führungsqualitäten ein, um die Leistungsfähigkeit dieses zentralen Arbeitsbereichs auf wöchentlicher, monatlicher und jährlicher Basis zu optimieren. Helfen Sie uns, Geschichte zu schreiben.

Ihre Aufgaben:

An erster Stelle steht eine 100-prozentige Kundenorientierung (eines unseres zentralen Führungsprinzipien). Sie arbeiten zielstrebig mit allen Kunden an der Lösung ihrer Probleme und streben immer danach, die Erwartungen zu erfüllen (oder zu übertreffen).

Sie müssen ein profundes Verständnis Ihrer Arbeitsabläufe entwickeln und stets nach Möglichkeiten streben, sich weiterzuentwickeln. Darüber hinaus nehmen Sie eine zentrale Rolle bei der Implementierung von Lösungen und Weiterentwicklungen im Rahmen möglicher Prozessänderungen in Ihrem Geschäftsbereich ein.

Das bedeutet, dass Sie vom ersten Tag an Einfluss auf die Effizienz unserer Arbeitsabläufe und die Qualität unseres Kundenservice nehmen. Als Senior Operations Manager streben Sie stets danach, die Produktivitätsziele zu übertreffen sowie ein zuverlässiges und beständiges Liefer- und Logistikteam aufzubauen und anzuleiten.

Im täglichen Betrieb stellen Sie sicher, dass die Lagerung stets im Einklang mit der entsprechenden Gesetzgebung und Firmenpolitik erfolgt. Dies erreichen Sie durch Aufsicht und Verantwortung sowie die Überprüfung und Bewertung aller Verfahren in Ihrem Zuständigkeitsbereich. Es wird von Ihnen erwartet, mit Ihren Aufgaben zu wachsen und sich an den Initiativen des stark ausgelasteten Amazon-Logistikbereichs zu beteiligen. Hin und wieder bringen Sie sich in funktionsübergreifenden Prozessen und Verbesserungsprojekten ein.

Schlussendlich verwalten und steuern Sie Personalbesetzungs- und Zeitpläne, Qualitätsinitiativen, Leistungsniveaus und Prozessänderungen, soweit sie sich auf Ihr Team auswirken.

title: Visual Designer, Advertising
description:
DESCRIPTION
The WW Amazon Advertising Custom team is looking for a talented and passionate Visual Designer with a track record of timely delivery, ownership, and execute unique deliverables for our advertising customers in Germany. In this role, you will provide unique customer solutions through world-class UX and UI design, conceptualisation of unique advertising ideas, execute them into visually stunning and effective campaigns that tell stories and drive business performance for the world’s leading brands.

The Visual Designer will work in close partnership with Art directors, Design Technologist and Creative Directors primarily in the DE local and provide secondary support in the EU wide custom team. You will produce innovative concepts for user centred advertising experiences spanning within and even beyond Amazon channels. You will work on designs ranging from campaign traffic drivers, landing pages (small scale) to world-wide brand deliverables (large scale in partnership with Art Directors) with schedules ranging from 1 week to 1 year, all with the same attention to excellence. You are a natural story teller with a profound understanding of hands-on design and technology. Prior experience in digital studios, advertising agencies or media environment is preferred.

Specific Responsibilities
· Create UI design, motion ideas, concepts and designs for innovative ad experiences for global brands.

· Create on-brand design solutions for all Amazon owned and operated channels that meet measurable business goals.

· Create user centred campaign executions by integrating marketing objectives, target audience, creative assets, Amazon design and motion patterns into intuitive solutions.

· Independently lead campaign executions and collaborate with EU design teams.

title: Visual Designer, Advertising
description:
DESCRIPTION

The WW Amazon Advertising Custom team is looking for a talented and passionate Visual Designer with a track record of timely delivery, ownership, and execute unique deliverables for our advertising customers in Germany and EU locals. In this role, you will provide unique customer solutions through world-class UX and UI design, conceptualization of unique advertising ideas, execute them into visually stunning and effective campaigns that tell stories and drive business performance for the world’s leading brands.

The Visual Designer will work in close partnership with Art directors, Design Technologist and Creative Directors primarily in the DE locale and provide secondary support in the EU wide custom team. You will produce innovative concepts for user centered advertising experiences spanning within and even beyond Amazon channels. You will work on designs ranging from campaign traffic drivers, landing pages (small scale) to world-wide brand deliverables (large scale in partnership with Art Directors) with schedules ranging from 1 week to 1 year, all with the same attention to excellence. You are a natural story teller with a profound understanding of hands-on design and technology. Prior experience in digital studios, advertising agencies or media environment is preferred.


Specific Responsibilities
· Create UI design, motion ideas, concepts and designs for innovative ad experiences for global brands.
·
· Create on-brand design solutions for all Amazon owned and operated channels that meet measurable business goals.
·
· Create user centered campaign executions by integrating marketing objectives, target audience, creative assets, Amazon design and motion patterns into intuitive solutions.
·
· Independently lead campaign executions and collaborate with EU design teams.

title: Software Development Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION
The AWS Identity team owns and operates highly scaleable, highly available distributed systems that are used by all AWS customers and internal service teams alike. We are pioneers in areas such as identity, access management, security and providing massively scaled, distributed platform capabilities to all of AWS. We enable our customers to control and secure the most sensitive data on the internet. We are building some of the largest and most complex distributed systems in the world, and we need brilliant engineering leaders to work with us on this new initiative!

We are building a new cloud platform that dramatically simplifies how enterprise customers manage and control access to their AWS resources. We are looking for a talented engineering leader who will be responsible for owning, driving and evangelising this space focused on enabling customers to manage and secure their AWS workloads at scale.

This position represents a rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor and help shape the technology, product, and business. A successful candidate will bring deep technical and software expertise, strong business acumen and judgement, the ability to define visionary, ground breaking products, ability to hire and lead a team, and the desire to have an industry-wide impact.

Learn and Be Curious. We have a formal mentor search application that lets you find a mentor that works best for you based on location, job family, job level etc. Your manager can also help you find a mentor or two, because two is better than one. In addition to formal mentors, we work and train together so that we are always learning from one another, and we celebrate and support the career progression of our team members.

Inclusion and Diversity. Our team is diverse! We drive towards an inclusive culture and work environment. We are intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. Team members are active in Amazon’s 10+ affinity groups, sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world.

Learn more about Amazon on our Day 1 Blog: https://blog.aboutamazon.com/

title: DSP Enterprise Support Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon Advertising is dedicated to driving measurable outcomes for brand advertisers, agencies, authors, and entrepreneurs. Our ad solutions - including sponsored, display, video, and custom ads - leverage Amazon’s innovations and insights to find, attract, and engage intended audiences throughout their daily journeys. With a range of flexible pricing and buying models, including self-service, managed service, and programmatic ad buying, these solutions help businesses build brand awareness, increase product sales, and more. We start with the customer and work backwards in everything we do, including advertising. If you’re interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising group with a relentless focus on the customer, you’ve come to the right place.

Amazon Advertising is seeking a Enterprise Support Manager based in Munich, Hamburg, Berlin or Düsseldorf for our Advertising Demand Side Platform.

In this role, you will own providing solutions for customer campaign execution issues and blockers by providing knowledgeable and responsive technical support to our enterprise customers. Our customers are large enterprises, direct advertisers and agencies. You will have ownership for issue investigation, identifying campaign configuration and software defects, in-depth and complex repro cases across our entire DSP portfolio, services and processes, workarounds, and researching solutions to unblock customers. This is a complex, and fast-paced environment as you will own the most critical part of the customer experience and delivering on our customers’ most basic need. While we obsess over incident response, in this role you will develop tools to scale our service quality, and provide critical input for product prioritization to address root causes of why the customer experienced an incident in the first place. Our advertising customers are likely Amazon customers, and we take seriously maintaining the high customer service bar set by Amazon to be the level at which we need to operate.

In this role, you will:
· Track, investigate, and resolve customer questions and issues by phone, email, and in person at various levels of complexity and customer impact.
· Act as an escalation point for the most complex and in-depth issues that potentially span multiple external and internal organizations.
· Communicate directly with internal organizations to complete root cause analyses, issue investigation, workarounds and defect resolution.
· Develop and implement complex repro cases to identify potential software defects, misconfigurations, or issues in customer environments.
· Use case management tools to manage and prioritize issues based on multiple factors including customer impact.
· Contribute to training material and documentation for both internal and customer-facing users.
· Perform data analysis via SQL queries. Utilize multiple BI Tools within the data platform to produce reports and self-service any other data needs. Detect and resolve issues through the configuration and managing of monitoring systems and alerts.
· Actively seeking solutions to customer needs, communicating trends to leadership, and suggesting innovative solutions on behalf of the customer experience.

title: Senior Instructional Designer
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon's EU Consumer Customer Service Support team is seeking a creative, tech-savvy Instructional Designer with experience in building engaging learner-centered and performance-based learning solutions that include application and customer interaction simulations and are deployed across multiple training modalities. As an Instructional Designer on this team, you will develop and maintain training programs that support Consumer Customer Service associates throughout the EU Region, and across our Global Organization. If you are a native English speaker, passionate about adult learning, fluent in German and/or Turkish and holding a solid command of application simulation tools, this job is for you!

The role can be based in Edinburgh, Madrid, Cork, Amsterdam, or at a Virtual location within the EU.

Key responsibilities:

Client Relationship Management
· Effectively communicate training strategies to senior-level leaders
· Collaborate with Subject Matter Experts across the network, regional and global stakeholders, business and operations teams, and members of the Learning Community (Instructional Design, Training Delivery, Evaluations & Insight Analysis)
Instructional Design-Project and Program Management
· Perform needs and task analysis to create targeted and engaging learning solutions that blend instructor-led with virtual classroom, gamified content, interactive videos, etc. as appropriate
· Follow a modular, standardized process to create performance-based training that is flexible, adaptable, measurable against key performance and learning experience metrics, and scales gracefully
· Simultaneously manage multiple, time-critical programs, project, translation and localization tasks and other design-development deliverables holding various level of complexity through their entire life-cycle


The succesful candidate is comfortable in a fast-paced, multi-tasked, high energy environment. They are an adult learning expert and a creative and analytical problem solver with a passion for excellence in customer service.

title: Senior Information Architect, Content. Amazon Business
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon Business is one of Amazon’s fastest growing new initiatives, providing business customers with the pricing, selection and convenience of Amazon, with features and benefits designed for businesses of all sizes. We are obsessed with our customers and in Customer Service, we make their experience delightful. We identify and drive business centric solutions by solving complex technical problems with ingenuity and simplicity, always seeking automation. We’re making history and the good news is that we’ve only just begun.


Amazon Business Information Architect role will sit within AB CS Knowledge team. We are a global team, supporting multiple regions and languages while still having loads of fun! In Amazon Business Customer Service, our vision is "We revolutionize support so customers can focus on their businesses". For that, we want our content to be structured, intuitive, simplified, reusable, and we want to deliver it in a dynamic, contextual, and proactive manner. But above all, we need our content models to be scalable. Your mission: make it happen!
You will advocate for both the customer and the end-user (author) by designing new content management lifecycles and content models, establishing authoring and publishing standards and governance for online documentation and customer facing content. You will collaborate with UX, Product, Content and Program Managers globally. You will be a content expert who has had a demonstrated leadership role on a large, multilingual content development team. You will have extensive experience with DITA and an enterprise-wide Content Management System (CMS), and have an applied knowledge of information architecture.
We are looking for someone who displays an uncompromising passion for reducing user effort and improving the effectiveness of our content. Passionate and enthusiast with strong leadership skills. Someone who builds partnerships and influence in a cross-functional environment with a cutting-edge vision. Capable of identify opportunities and influence organizations to gain support and overcome resistance with data and persuasion. Someone who is a problem solver with the ability to communicate expectations and requirements equally well with business and technology teams, and write well-reasoned and data-driven proposals, performing your own data analysis as needed.



The Information Architect will be responsible for:
· Partnering with Product and Technology teams, content administrators, and end-users to assess the current content experience and determine immediate and long-term needs to support content use.
· Designing, implementing, and maintaining high-quality, multi-format outputs in many languages.
· Identify opportunities for automation and simplification, and roll out implementation.
· Creating strategies and rolling out implementation of DITA-based, structured, and reusable content using an Agile methodology.
· Defining the informational model for new upcoming Customer Service products.
· Researching and incorporating industry best practices and innovation into our information architecture (IA).
· Developing and maintaining taxonomies, metadata models, conditionalization, and classification schemas across our content.
· Developing a roadmap that includes immediate, easy-win improvements but also ultimately leads to a revolutionary change in how we plan, store, process, manage, and access content.

title: Sr Manager, Software Development - Redshift
description:
DESCRIPTION
Want to make database history? Come and join the team that is building the most popular cloud data warehousing service in the world with tens of thousands of customers - Amazon Redshift. We are building the next generation data warehouse systems, creating an impact on its hundreds of thousands of users, and looking for top engineers to help shape the future.

Amazon Redshift is the leading, fully-managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse in the cloud. Using Amazon Redshift makes it simple and cost-effective to analyze all your data seamlessly.

As a Senior Software Development Manager of Tooling, Infrastructure and QA with Amazon Redshift, you will have the opportunity to lead the team that delivers tools and infrastructure to support developer productivity, quality assurance and performance across the AWS Redshift organization. You will take ownership on our overall strategy to drive engineering productivity, ensure quality and security, streamline builds and deployments, and spearhead the organization’s best practices. You will also build out automation of critical operational functions that ensure thousands of servers across all AWS regions worldwide operate smoothly at massive scale and at lowest cost.

In this role you will lead the teams to innovate and solve problems of high ambiguity and high impact. You will meticulously review and drive design choices, trade-offs, priorities and timelines. You will demonstrate exceptional management skills and technical expertise, and practical experience building large-scale distributed systems. You are data and metric driven, and obsessively concerned about performance under resource constrained environments. You will mentor and inspire other managers and engineers, participate in defining our engineering culture, and help to build a fast-growing and highly self-motivated team. You will draw from your deep and broad technical and management expertise to mentor senior engineers and managers, complete hands-on technical work and provide leadership on complex technical issues, design tradeoffs, and feature and schedule prioritization. And as an engineering leader in Redshift, you will work with senior AWS executives to develop business targets and resource requirements, influence our technical and business strategy, help hire talented engineers and managers, and conceive innovative new solutions for our customers.
Joining the Amazon Redshift team gives you the opportunity to:

· Work on a disruptive product that’s still in its early stages
· Solve challenging problems that will revolutionize database computing in the cloud
· Build a product that will leverage the scale of resources available in the cloud
· Help enable the digital transformation of our 1,000’s of customer’s businesses, which is at the forefront of leading CEO’s minds
This is a unique and rare opportunity to get in on the ground floor with Redshift and work in an exciting startup environment. Come, join us in reinventing database systems for the cloud!

title: Software Development Manager (AWS AQUA)
description:
DESCRIPTION
AWS is building a new distributed query accelerator that provides the foundation for a next wave of performance improvement and innovation in cloud-based analytics. AQUA, Advanced Query Accelerator, was designed from the ground up to minimize unnecessary data movement by using large, high-speed caches, custom hardware, and by pushing reduction and aggregation computation closer to rapidly expanding analytics data. AQUA uses hardware acceleration to efficiently filter and aggregate data and minimize data transmission over the network by sending only the results. This new capability enables AWS Redshift to run up to 10x faster than any other cloud data warehouse.
We are looking for contributors in areas of storage, hardware-software abstraction and co-design, query processing, data and control plane development for multi-tenant, distributed systems, hardware design verification and database performance engineering to help us build this new technology and integrate into analytics platforms.

For this specific role we are looking for Software Development Manager who has a strong track record building successful products and services and grown high performance development teams. You will be responsible to build and grow a development team, to rethink assumptions behind how traditional data warehouse services are built, how to build database services best suited for the cloud with heterogenous hardware stack and integrating AQUA with data analytics services. You will provide leadership on complex and challenging technical and project issues. You are an expert in distributed, high performance computation, data processing or analytics. You should be passionate about optimizing the software development methodology at a very large scale, using your strong technical skills and motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment. You are naturally enthusiastic about learning new technologies and industry trends and are excited by the idea of enabling and guiding your team solving hard technical challenges.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

title: Working Student (Werkstudent) - Acquisition Marketing (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Good storytelling starts with great listening. At Audible, that means each role and every project has our audience in mind. Because the same people who design, develop, and deploy our products also happen to use them. To us, that speaks volumes.

Based in Berlin, Audible is looking for a motivated and committed Working Student (Werkstudent) - Acquisition Marketing (m/w/d) who will support our marketing team in in the DACH region with the acquisition of new customers through marketing campaigns on the websites and Amazon devices. You especially take ownership in creating engaging marketing campaigns, analyzing the results and documenting our performance metrics on a weekly basis.

As a Working Student in Acquisition Marketing, you will:
· Schedule Amazon onsite campaigns, acquisition-marketing emails and campaigns on Amazon device surfaces, using different content management and email marketing tools
· Work closely in collaboration with graphic designers to ensure enhancing and engaging content for our marketing campaigns
· Collaborate with colleagues from variety of teams within Audible but also Amazon
· Work on customer segmentation for email and onsite marketing activities
· Support us in the preparation of weekly metrics reports and gather product/customer analysis to improve the performance of our products

title: Senior Product and Customer Insights Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION
Want to apply your customer research and survey design skills to build insights and shape business strategies for Amazon across different businesses and geographies? The Customer Experience Strategy organization is looking for a highly motivated, creative and curious individual to join our Customer Loyalty Strategy team in Munich or London.

As a Senior Product and Customer Insights Manager you will lead customer research across multiple geographies, product lines (e.g. media, consumer electronics, apparel, etc.) and domains (Retail, Marketplace, Digital, etc.). The insights you generate will have a direct impact on how business partners shape customer experience improvement initiatives. With a dynamic, innovative and diverse environment, this role will provide you with ample opportunities to constantly build your skill set and address new challenges while you help Amazon to achieve its vision: to be Earth's Most Customer-Centric Company. The right candidate will be excited about the opportunity to be our customer insights evangelist and influence customer experience on Amazon!

Responsibilities include:
· Customer Research and Analytics: Design, execute, and manage customer research to measure customer loyalty and Net Promoter Score (NPS) and identify opportunities to improve CX.
· Manage ambiguity: Understand complex business problems across business units, geographies and product lines to create hypotheses and translate this into analysis requirements and identify meaningful insights that help Amazon improve our customer experience
· Product Management: Ability to gather and articulate business need(s), develop hypotheses, and design research product(s) to help business teams drive customer-inspired actions for improvement of Amazon products and services.
· Teamwork: Work cross functionally with peers globally to support training, best practices, and shared opportunities.
· Stakeholder management: Build strong relations with stakeholders to understand priorities, define the roadmap and to collaborate and work with them on studies and actions to improve our customers' experience.
The right candidate will:
· Have experience conducting market research (incl. surveys)
· Have a passion for continuously improving customer experience
· Have experience influencing and earning the trust of senior stakeholders and moving business teams to take action
· Be curious, eager to learn, and think outside the box to innovate
· Be a self-starter who solves problems and follows up on commitments in a timely manner while also being a team player
· Communicate openly and proactively with peers and leadership
· Be flexible and have a track record of delivering results in a fast-paced and highly ambiguous work environment
· Have a strong sense of urgency and commitment

title: Senior Vendor Manager (m/f/d) Amazon Fresh
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon is looking for a talented, driven, and entrepreneurial Senior Vendor Manager (m/f/d) for our Fresh and Prime Now business. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in one of Amazon's core initiatives during a turning point in its growth trajectory.

An ideal candidate is highly motivated to deliver results, with strong analytical capabilities and project management skills, great attention to detail, and the ability to effectively prioritize and multi-task. A core focus of this role will be to define our internal strategy and processes for our Non-Consumables business within Prime Now and Fresh (Hardlines, Media, Softlines, Devices). This will require you to build and manage strong relationships with Amazon-internal product lines as well as industry-leading stakeholders from our external partners. A successful candidate will furthermore combine creativity and commercial acumen to identify new business opportunities that will allow you to grow this strategic category. Simultaneously you will develop and improve scalable processes that will enable your category to react quickly to shifts in customer demands and tastes to enable a world-class customer experience.

A successful candidate will be comfortable thinking strategically, and also be able and willing to execute operational details. This role interacts closely with other departments such as supply chain, selection management, other retail categories and marketing across Amazon, and is pivotal to the long terms success of Amazon Fresh and Prime Now in Germany. The candidate will communicate effectively across teams and levels, while balancing the needs and requirements of internal and external customers. We seek an individual who is motivated by a fast-paced and highly entrepreneurial environment.


Key Responsibilities:
· Conduct financial analysis of business opportunities, drive internal projects to meet and exceed our targets
· Manage relationships with Amazon-internal teams and vendors, represent Amazon when meeting with vendors’ senior executive teams
· Conduct selection definition, optimization as part of an internationally acting selection core group
· P&L responsibility for the managed categories and vendors: negotiate the best costs, create and sell marketing packages, forecast demand, and grow sales and margin
· Represent our initiative within cross-department vendor relationships and find best ways to accommodate our needs
· Work with internal teams to drive tools and process improvements that affect purchasing and procurement workflows, with emphasis on automating tasks that are currently performed manually
· Work with retail vendor management teams across Amazon.de to represent the marketing opportunities and generate marketing packages from across all Amazon categories

title: Data Operations Team Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION
All Amazon teams and businesses, from Prime delivery to AWS, are guided by four key tenets: customer obsession rather than competitor focus, passion for invention, commitment to operational excellence, and long-term thinking.

We are driven by the excitement of building technologies, inventing products, and providing services that transform the way our customers live their lives and run their businesses.

Our mission: To be Earth's most customer-centric company.

What unites Amazonians across teams and geographies is that we are all striving to delight our customers and make their lives easier. The scope and scale of our mission drives us to seek diverse perspectives, be resourceful, and navigate through ambiguity. Inventing and delivering things that were never thought possible isn't easy, but we embrace this challenge every day.

By working together on behalf of our customers, we are building the future one innovative product, service, and idea at a time.

Come build the future with us.

We are looking for a talented and highly motivated Data Operations Team Manager. You will build, train and lead a team of Data Linguists, performing linguistic and technical operations aiming at improvement of Machine Learning technology in Berlin, Germany.

You can work with minimum direction, are very detail-oriented, have demonstrated experience in people management, have excellent project management skills, and possesses very strong written and verbal communication skills.
Specifically, the Data Operations Team Manager will:
· Manage job assignment for a team of Data Linguists (typically with Linguistics or Localization/Translation background) on a day-to-day basis
· Support hiring and training of new Data Linguists
· Ensure productivity is maximized through supervision, training, analysis, and feedback of performance data on a periodic basis
· Provide regular, formal and informal feedback to direct reports
· Develop the work schedule for the week by balancing work across various workflows and/or navigating competing delivery priorities, proposing risk mitigation strategies where necessary
· Partner closely with Program Managers, Technical Program Managers, and other global operations team leads on protocol/process development for existing and future language development workflows
· Track and report on quality and utilization metrics
· File and track tickets, following up on blocks to productivity
· Identify and help implement process-related improvement using methodologies such as Scrum, Kaizen, Six Sigma.

title: Senior Rentals Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION
At Amazon, we're working to be the most Customer-centric company on earth. One customer experience that we’re constantly looking to take to a new level is how we fulfill and deliver their orders. Our goal is to exceed the expectations of all our customers by ensuring that their orders, no matter how large or small are delivered where and when they need them, as quickly, accurately, and cost effectively as possible. To meet this goal, Amazon is continually striving to innovate and provide best in class service levels through the introduction of pioneering new products and services in the last mile delivery space. Come join the team and help us make history!

We are looking for a Senior Fleet Rentals Manager. The role will play a vital role in advancing Amazon’s unique culture and enabling the success of our Delivery Service Providers (DSP) within the high-growth, fast-paced Logistics organization. The role will be responsible to create demand plans for our Rental program in order to meet customer needs and drive to execution with our partner organizations (Finance, Procurement, Network Planning, DSP teams) effectively and efficiently across our EU operating countries. The role also owns the design and development of the Rental program that will scale with vehicle growth and includes building multiple planning and investment scenarios. She/he will be required to monitor and identify upstream/downstream changes to incorporate into short, medium- and long-term planning.

The successful candidate will have program ownership of EU Rental planning and execution whilst optimizing costs, drive continuous improvements for Rental program across EU operating countries to solve for seasonal demand and engage with senior internal teams (international) and external stakeholders.

Key job responsibilities will be:
· Drive planning of Rental fleet and execution with third party Rental providers and internal stakeholders across EU operating countries
· Engage and align effectively across the business (Finance, DSP teams, Network Planning), Rental providers, internal stakeholders and senior leadership to ensure achievement of goals
· Stay connected to the Operators to satisfy demand and control damage costs in the field
· Build mechanisms to continuously re-evaluate and evolve our services based on customer feedback
· Regularly update EU senior leadership on the status and key metrics
The position can be placed in Luxembourg, London, Berlin or Munich. A placement in one of our Delivery Stations across the countries is also an option.

title: Software Development Engineer
description:
DESCRIPTION
The Amazon Speech team is a group of developers and scientists working on audio, speech and natural language solutions that revolutionize how customers interact with Amazon’s products and services. The team’s mission is to push the envelope in automatic speech recognition (ASR) in order to provide the best possible experience for our customers. Products such as Amazon Echo, Amazon Dash, and Fire TV are illustrative of the customer-delighting spoken language solutions Amazon is building.


The team is growing and we are hiring several software engineers to join our teams in Aachen.

We are looking for passionate and talented Software Engineers who have experience building innovative, mission critical, highly scalable applications that customers love.
As part of the team, you will have an opportunity to be at the front lines of speech recognition and speech processing technologies. In your role as a Software Development Engineer, you will have an opportunity to define the technical direction of the platform and the tools that support building state of the art machine learning models used at runtime by Alexa. Your work will have a large impact on the design, architecture, and implementation of everything the team works on. If developing scalable, distributed services and designing long-term platform architectures excites you and you revel in thinking about well-architect code we would love to talk to you!

title: Strategic Account Manager (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Wir glauben, dass bei Amazon jeder Tag "Day One" ist. Ein Tag, den ersten Schritt zu tun. Ein Tag, sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen. Und heute könnte der Tag sein, an dem Sie selbst Teil einer großen Idee werden. Ein Tag, an dem Sie Ihre eigenen Ideen verwirklichen können. Kommen Sie zu einem Unternehmen, das sich jeden Tag neu erfindet. Bei Amazon zu arbeiten, ist immer wieder aufregend. Es ist unsere Vision, der Ort zu sein, an dem Kunden schnell und bequem alles finden, was sie kaufen möchten - zu einem günstigen Preis. Dabei unterstützen uns auch Händler, die ihre eigenen Produkte über Amazon anbieten. Für diesen stark wachsenden Geschäftszweig suchen wir einen Account und Projekt Manager (m/w/d) Marketplace. Ihre Aufgabe als Account und Projekt Manager (m/w/d) ist es, unseren größten Händlern eine optimale Betreuung zu bieten sowie Projekte zur Optimierung unseres Account Managements zu leiten. Ihre Herausforderungen:

· Als erster Ansprechpartner macht es Ihnen Freude, unsere strategischen Partner kompetent zu betreuen und entlang ehrgeiziger Ziele weiter zu entwickeln – dies beinhaltet auch den Vertrieb weiterer Amazon-Produkte.
· Sie initiieren und verantworten Projekte zur Weiterentwicklung unserer Accounts.
· Managements und Optimierung unserer Services und stimmen sich hierzu mit Ihren internationalen Kollegen ab.
· Mittels detaillierter Auswertungen und Datenbankabfragen beobachten Sie ständig den Erfolg Ihres Kundenportfolios und konzipieren adäquate Optimierungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmaßnahmen.
· Sie verantworten die Durchführung von Trainings, Webinars und Händlertagungen.
· Bei der Ausarbeitung von Budgets und Forecasts unterstützen Sie unsere Teams mit entsprechenden Analysen und Auswertungen.
· Sie arbeiten sehr eng mit den Bereichen Neukundenakquise, Produktmanagement, Kategorie-Management und Verkäuferservice zusammen.

title: Graduate Sales Representative, Transportation
description:
DESCRIPTION

Location of the role is in Munich
You need to speak German on a near native level

Amazon Freight - Amazon's newly launched external facing freight service - is hiring for Graduate Account Executive Roles...join us in building the next big thing at Amazon.

Amazon Freight is a start-up team within Amazon Transportation Services in Europe, which is responsible for many of Amazon’s best-in-class logistics and transportation operations. Amazon Freight allows Shippers to use Amazon’s transportation network to transport products in bulk across Europe. This is an innovative technology-driven solution for the shipping needs of small and large businesses and is scaling rapidly as an offering.
We are looking to hire Munich based Account Executive positions as part of our recently built Business Development Team. This person will be responsible for recruiting Shippers onto the program, owning and growing Shipper engagements, and ensuring a great Shipper experience.

The successful candidate will be results driven, highly analytical, Customer obsessed, and ready to roll up the sleeves to grow this business.


Key responsibilities include:
- Recruit shippers onto the program and achieve sales and volume goals with best-in-class service
- Nurture and grow engagements with existing Shippers
- Be the voice of the Customer (shipper) to guide product development and iterations
- Lead new projects and initiatives to solve Customer pain points and improve Shipper experience
- Explore industry trends to identify new business opportunities

title: Teamlead Amazon Global Selling (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon ist eine der führenden e-Commerce-Plattformen weltweit. Mehr als zwei Millionen Verkäufer, darunter Kleinunternehmen, Mittelständler und weltbekannte Handelsmarken nutzen die verschiedenen Verkäufer-Services von Amazon. Sie vergrößern damit ihren Erfolg und erreichen neue Kunden sowohl bei Amazons Marktplätzen als auch im eigenen Online-Shop. Werden Sie Teil dieser internationalen Erfolgsgeschichte und starten Sie Ihre Karriere bei Amazon!

Zur Verstärkung unseres Amazon Global Selling -Teams suchen wir eine/n Teamlead (m/w/d) in Berlin im Bereich Global Business Development.

Versand durch Amazon bietet Händlern, die bereits bei Amazon in Europa verkaufen, die Möglichkeit, ihre Waren mit Amazon weltweit zu versenden. Damit profitieren diese Händler nicht nur von Amazons Logistik-Expertise, weil Kunden Amazons schnellen und zuverlässigen Versand besonders schätzen, es eröffnet sich teilnehmenden Händlern gleichzeitig auch neue Umsatz- und Expansionschancen in mehr als 180 Ländern.

Als Teamlead AGS (m/w/d) ist es Ihre Aufgabe ein dynamisches Team von strategischen Account Managern zu führen und zu entwickeln, um das Amazon Global Selling Business auf das nächste Level zu bringen. Darüber hinaus gewinnen Sie strategische Händler für die Expansion auf Amazons internationale Marktplätze wie z.B. die USA, Australien oder Japan, und unterstützen diese beim Start dieses Services. Zudem arbeiten Sie an der Weiterentwicklung und Effizienzsteigerung unserer Services und den internen Prozesse cross-divisional mit. Diese Position ist ideal um Ihre Karriere im e-Commerce voranzubringen und eröffnet Ihnen ausgezeichnete Perspektiven für Ihre zukünftige Entwicklung bei Amazon.

Ihre Aufgaben:
· Sie führen ein strategisch ausgerichtetes Account Management Team, und Sie für dessen Erfolg verantwortlich.
· Sie identifizieren Händler, deren Produktportfolio großes Verkaufspotential auf den internationalen Marktplätzen wie z.B. USA hat.
· Sie analysieren und treiben die Zusammenarbeit mit Ihren Händlern durch detaillierte Auswertungen und Handlungsempfehlungen, mit dem Ziel die Geschäfte des Händlers auf den internationalen Amazon-Marktplätzen auf- und auszubauen.
· Sie arbeiten eng mit Kollegen aus anderen Verkäufer-Services, sowie mit Kollegen aus Amazons Retail-Team und dem operativen Logistik-Management auf der ganzen Welt zusammen, um interne Prozesse weiterzuentwickeln und so unsere Verkaufspartner noch besser unterstützen zu können.

title: Automation Engineer (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
We Pioneer.

Ein Tag, den ersten Schritt zu tun. Ein Tag, sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen. Und heute könnte der Tag sein, an dem Sie selbst Teil einer großen Idee werden. Ein Tag, an dem Sie Ihre eigenen Ideen verwirklichen können. Kommen Sie zu einem Unternehmen, das sich jeden Tag neu erfindet.

Als Automation Engineer sind Sie verantwortlich für die Fehlersuche, Fehlerbehebung und Verbesserung der Steuerungslösungen für automatisierte Materialtransportgeräte (MHE), wie z.B. Förderbänder, Sortiersysteme, Scanner, Kameras, Druck- und Anwendungssysteme, Waagen, HMI-Systeme und Schaltschränke.

Sie dienen als Sachverständige(r) für alle Steuerungssysteme und Sensoren innerhalb des Gebäudes und verantworten dessen Fehlerdiagnosen.
· Sie dienen als Sachverständige(r) für alle Steuerungssysteme und Sensoren innerhalb des Gebäudes und verantworten dessen Fehlerdiagnosen.Sie arbeiten aktiv an der Überwachung, Fehlersuche und Reparatur dieser Systeme, um eine hohe Geräteverfügbarkeit für interne Kunden zu gewährleisten.
· Sie verantworten Schwachstellenanalysen, Konzeptentwicklung und die Durchführung von Maßnahmen zur Optimierung von förder- und gebäudetechnischen Abläufen.
· Sie arbeiten an der kontinuierlichen Verbesserung der Anlagen-/Prozessverfügbarkeit und führen interne Trainings für die Instandhaltungstechniker durch.
· Sie schulen Techniker(innen) in den Grundlagen der Fehlerbehebung für die Kontrollsysteme, um den Wissensstand am Standort zu verbessern.
· Sie arbeiten mit dem EU Control-Netzwerk zusammen, um die Überwachung der MHE-Kennzahlen zu verbessern und internen Kunden Visualisierungen und Daten bereitzustellen.
· Sie beteiligen sich aktiv oder leiten Projekte zur fortlaufenden Verbesserung des EU Control-Netzwerks.
· Sie stellen in Zusammenarbeit mit IT, EU Control-Engineering und Operation-Engineering sicher, dass alle Systeme korrekt dokumentiert sind und genaue Backup-Bibliotheken gepflegt werden.
· Sie arbeiten mit weltweiten Teams zusammen, um die Installation und Inbetriebnahme neuer Geräte zu unterstützen.
· Nach Bedarf unterstützen Sie andere Standorte innerhalb des europäischen Netzwerks.

title: Commercial Finance Analyst
description:
DESCRIPTION
The EU Amazon Fashion Business team is looking for a Commercial Finance Business Partner based in Munich. At Amazon, Finance is not just about the numbers. We are trusted advisors who help take the best possible commercial and operational decisions so that Amazon continues to grow whilst remaining the Earth's most customer-centric company. We dive deep to develop innovative solutions and don't shy away from challenging the status quo.
The role will have broad responsibilities and partner with various teams and stakeholders across Europe to fuel the growth of the Amazon Fashion business:
· You co-own the financial success of Amazon Fashion Business. You will consult, challenge and influence business strategy, decisions and drive our long-term free cash flow
· You run ad-hoc analyses, review business cases and actively participate in projects to ensure we are taking the right decisions in our business
· You analyze the business with weekly and monthly key performance indicators
· You run and continuously improve the short- and midterm planning processes, month end closing and financial compliance
This job allows flexible working hours including work from home.

title: Account Manager Prime (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION

Amazon ist einer der weltweit führenden Anbieter im Bereich E-Commerce. Mehr als zwei Millionen Verkäufer, darunter Kleinunternehmen, Mittelständler und weltbekannte Handelsmarken nutzen die verschiedenen Verkäufer-Services von Amazon. Sie vergrößern damit ihren Erfolg und erreichen neue Kunden sowohl bei Amazons Marktplätzen als auch im eigenen Online-Shop. Werden Sie Teil dieser internationalen Erfolgsgeschichte und starten Sie Ihre Karriere bei Amazon!

Zur Verstärkung unseres Prime-Teams suchen wir Account Manager (m/w/d) in München.
Das Amazon Prime Team unterstützt aktive Händler auf Amazon dabei, ihre Produkte in unserem Prime Programm anzubieten und darüber ihre Verkäufe zu optimieren.

Händler können bei Amazon aus zwei Prime Programmen wählen: 1) „Versand durch Amazon” bietet Händlern, die Möglichkeit, ihre Waren direkt bei Amazon einzulagern und von Amazon versenden zu lassen. Damit profitieren diese nicht nur von Amazons Logistik-Expertise sondern auch vom Kundenvertrauen in Amazon’s schnellen und zuverlässigen Lieferservice. Darüber hinaus eröffnen sich teilnehmenden Händlern neue Umsatzchancen unsere Logistik Services zu nutzen um über die deutschen Landesgrenzen hinweg im Ausland zu verkaufen. („Paneuropäischer Versand durch Amazon“).
2) „Prime durch Verkäufer“ ist das Versandprogramm, mit dem Händler Prime Kunden direkt aus ihrem eigenen Warenlager beliefern können. Um ihre Produkte Prime anzubieten, ermöglichen Händler eine Lieferung innerhalb von Deutschland am nächsten Tag.

Ihre Aufgabe als Account Manager Prime ist es, Händler für unsere Prime Programme zu gewinnen, sie beim Start dieser Services zu begleiten und anschließend ihr Geschäft national und international kontinuierlich auszubauen. Darüber hinaus arbeiten Sie aktiv in Projekten zur Weiterentwicklung und Effizienzsteigerung unserer Händler Services und internen Prozesse cross-divisional mit. Diese Position ist ideal für die weitere Entwicklung Ihrer Karriere im e-Commerce und eröffnet Ihnen ausgezeichnete Perspektiven bei Amazon.

Ihre Aufgaben:

· Als Account Manager gewinnen Sie Händler für unsere Prime Programme und arbeiten kontinuierlich mit Ihren Händlern daran, ihr Prime Sortiment auszubauen

· Sie sind zentraler Ansprechpartner und es macht Ihnen Freude, unsere strategischen Partner kompetent zu betreuen und entlang ehrgeiziger Ziele weiter zu entwickeln; dies geschieht in einem zeitlich begrenzten Account Management-Ansatz, in dem Sie eigenverantwortlich Prioritäten setzen.

· Mittels detaillierter Auswertungen beobachten Sie ständig den Erfolg Ihres Kundenportfolios und konzipieren adäquate Optimierungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmaßnahmen.

· Sie beteiligen sich aktiv an der Durchführung von Trainings, Webinars und Händlertagungen.

· Bei der Ausarbeitung von Budgets und Forecasts unterstützen Sie unsere Teams mit entsprechenden Analysen und Auswertungen.

· Sie arbeiten sehr eng mit den Bereichen Neukundenakquise, Produktmanagement, Kategorie-Management, Verkäuferservice und Operations zusammen.

· Sie initiieren und treiben Projekte zur Weiterentwicklung unseres Account Managements sowie der Optimierung unserer Services und stimmen sich hierzu intern ab, auch mit Ihren internationalen Kollegen.

title: Graduate Analyst
description:
DESCRIPTION

Locations: Dortmund, Hamburg and Munich


Amazon is a company of builders. A philosophy of ownership carries through everything we do — from the proprietary technologies we create to the new businesses we launch and grow. You’ll find it in every team across our company; from providing Earth’s biggest selection of products to developing ground-breaking software and devices that change entire industries, Amazon embraces invention and progressive thinking. Amazon is continually evolving; it’s a place where motivated employees thrive, and ownership and accountability lead to meaningful results. It’s as simple as this: we pioneer.

With every order made and parcel delivered, customer demand at Amazon is growing. And to meet this demand, and keep our world-class service running smoothly, we're growing our Operations team across Europe. We are seeking a savvy, motivated Graduate Analysts to join our available roles in the Fulfilment Center Finance team.

About the role

Are you passionate about leveraging data to deliver actionable insight that impacts daily business decision of Amazon? Does the prospect of dealing with massive volume of data excite you? Amazon has culture of data-driven decision-making, and demands business intelligence that is timely, accurate, and actionable. During our day-to-day operations, tons of data is generated which is leveraged to make our important business decisions.

As a Graduate Analyst you will be analyzing and driving improvements to make sure the organization is fit for the future. You will do so by developing queries, macros and tools to support your day-to-day function alongside diving deep into the problems you encounter. You will work with key stakeholders to ensure that decisions are made and actioned which will allow our operations to run as efficiently as possible. You will challenge the unknown and try to drive improvement into key areas of our business.

A successful candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, is comfortable accessing and working with big data from multiple sources, and passionately partners with the business to identify strategic opportunities and deliver results. They should have an internal drive to answer “why?” questions, excellent analytical abilities, strong technical skills, as well as superior written and verbal communication skills. They would be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, able to think big (while paying careful attention to detail), and enjoy working in a fast-paced dynamic environment.

You would be a great fit for this role if you enjoy and excel at:

· Using your analytical skills to generate and implement innovative and disruptive ideas
· Solving complex analytical problems and drawing conclusions from large data sets
· Continuously learning new skills and knowledge areas to grow, develop, and better serve our customers
· Working with a broad set of stakeholders from diverse and dynamic teams

Job responsibilities

· Collecting, analyzing and coordinating quantitative data and creating meaningful reports/dashboards to define business improvement and cost reductions
· Root cause analysis and uncovering core issues using data, then assisting the business improve and creating new measures
· Recommending, developing, and implementing policies, processes and programs that guide the organization in maintaining and improving its current position and profitability
· Establishing and maintaining accurate operating and business metrics
· Providing and communicating reporting and analysis to senior stakeholders
· Developing the right performance indicators and maintaining them at scale
· Working with data source providers and technology teams to ensure that key decision data is accurate, automated and timely
· Handling complex priorities and providing level-headed guidance during ambiguous/unexpected events

title: Chief Technologist, Public Sector, Europe
description:
DESCRIPTION
Are you a highly creative problem solver that works to inspire, motivate, and define cutting edge solutions? Are you a deeply technical generalist that can see the future, adapt quickly to new situations, identify opportunities, and build capabilities? Are you able to speak both the language of business and the language of technology?


At Amazon Web Services, we’re hiring Chief Technologists as trusted advisors to our sales leaders and key customers. Chief Technologists partner closely with sales leaders to drive the strategic technology capabilities that deliver long-term value for customers. Chief Technologists work across a global community of peers to identify common customer experiences; what is coming next; bring innovative thinking to customer challenges; advocate within AWS for our customers; and inspire, motivate, and inform technical service and field teams. Chief Technologists Think Big, and they engage internally to AWS and externally with industry to advance the needs of our customers.


Responsibilities:
· Demonstrate Amazon's Culture of Innovation
· Identify, synthesize, capture, and share common customer patterns
· Partner with customer tech leaders, including CIOs and CTOs
· Serve as the AWS executive technical sponsor for strategic customer initiatives
· Drive technical capabilities aligned to business strategy
· Guide customers on their cloud journey
· Participate in and present at industry events
· Contribute to and help publish content that points toward the future and supports scale, standardization, and repeatability
· Understand and participate in Public Sector acquisition activities, including technical guidance and demonstrations

title: Regional IT Manager (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Regional IT Manager (m/w/d) - Süddeutschland

Amazon leistet Pionierarbeit.
Seit den ersten Anfängen im Jahre 1995 haben wir die Grenzen des Möglichen immer wieder neu erfunden.
Wir arbeiten daran, das Unternehmen mit der stärksten Kundenorientierung der Welt zu werden, bei dem jeder das finden und kaufen kann, was sein Herz begehrt. Mit Ihrer Hilfe können wir weiterhin intelligent arbeiten und unsere Kunden begeistern.

Für unser IT Team in Deutschland suchen wir eine(n) Regional IT Manager (m/w/d) mit der IT-Verantwortung für alle Amazon Logistikstandorte im Raum Süddeutschland.

Als Regional IT Manager übernehmen Sie die Leitung der IT Teams der Standorte in Bad Hersfeld, Frankenthal, Pforzheim und Graben und der dazugehörigen externen Logistikstandorte. Sie berichten an den DE Regionalen IT Manager und entwickeln Ihr eigenes Team aktiv zur Integration neuer Technologien und der Optimierung der heterogenen IT-Systemlandschaft. In Ihrer Funktion arbeiten Sie in enger Kooperation mit dem regionalen Senior-Management und internationalen IT-Abteilungen sowie IT Dienstleistern. Sie finden klare Worte, haben echte Führungsqualität und legen dabei Wert auf Kundenorientierung. Sie steuern internationale IT-Projekte im Logistik­bereich, verantworten deren Ressourcen und Budgets. Die zu unterstützende IT Umgebung setzt sich sowohl aus lokalen Komponenten an den Standorten des Großraum Süddeutschland, als auch aus standortübergreifenden Diensten in der Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud zusammen. Sie lieben es, sich stetig auf neue Herausforderungen und Aufgabenstellungen einzulassen und in einem sehr dynamischen, stark wachsenden sowie flexiblen Umfeld mit Ihrem Know-how Lösungen voranzutreiben.

Unter anderem beinhaltet Ihre Tätigkeit folgende Aufgabenfelder:
· Führung und kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung mehrerer IT-Teams
· Verantwortung für IT-Infrastruktur mehrerer Amazon Logistikstandorte
· Ressourcen- und Budgetplanung für die Wartung und den Ausbau der IT Infrastruktur
· Sicherstellung des Incident- und Problem Managements nach den internen Service Level Agreements (SLAs)
· Reporting der IT Prozesse und der zugehörigen KPIs sowie Erstellung von ad hoc-Analysen
· Verantwortlich für die Stabilität sowie die Umsetzung taktischer Maßnahmen und Optimierungen der IT-Landschaft
· Aufbau und Etablierung von neuen IT Services inkl. deren Beschreibung und Qualitätsmanagement
· Review und Kommunikation von kritischen IT Infrastrukturveränderungen (Change Management)
· Überwachung des IT Asset Managements sowie Planung und Beschaffung von IT Hardware
· IT Projektmanagement und Leitung der Teams zum Aufbau der IT-Infrastruktur an neuen Standorten
· Erstellen von Entscheidungsvorlagen, CAPEX Anforderungen und Lösungsbeschreibungen
· Betreiben eines adäquaten und zeitnahen Eskalationsmanagements bei IT-Problemen
· Sicherstellung und Kommunikation konzernweiter IT Standards, Prozesse und Security Richtlinien
· Anforderungsmanagement der Kundenschnittstelle und Ableitung erfolgreicher Lösungen
· IT Prozessoptimierung und Begleitung von IT Innovationen
· Beratungsfunktion für das regionale Senior Management im Rahmen der IT Infrastruktur
· Unterstützung beim IT Recruiting im dynamisch wachsenden Amazon Netzwerk

title: Bereichsleiter Logistik (w/m/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Seit den ersten Anfängen im Jahre 1995 haben wir die Grenzen des Möglichen immer wieder neu erfunden.

Das oberste Ziel unseres Unternehmens ist die Zufriedenheit unserer Kunden. Vom Moment der Online-Bestellung bis zur reibungslosen Koordination dieser Bestellung hinter den Kulissen wollen wir stets flexibel, agil und zielgerichtet auftreten. Daher lautet eines unserer zentralen Führungsprinzipien "Im Zweifel: Handeln"! Wir möchten, dass unsere Teams zusammenarbeiten, die Dinge anpacken und sich nicht mit dem Status quo zufriedengeben. Es ist unser Ziel, das kundenfreundlichste Unternehmen der Welt aufzubauen.


Wir sind stetig auf der Suche nach Talenten, die schnell Verantwortung übernehmen und Teil eines Teams werden möchten, das Innovation und Exzellenz im Bereich Operations noch weiter ausbaut.
Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir deshalb ab sofort eine(n) Bereichsleiter (w/m/d) in unbefristeter Festanstellung.


Deine Aufgaben:
Als rechte Hand des Standortleiters, managest du aktiv dein internes Team sowie Drittanbieter und treibst die Optimierung unserer Logistikprozesse stetig voran.
Zum einem überwachst du hierbei die Logistik und Lieferung anhand festgelegter Leistungskennzahlen, und kommunizierst diese, einschließlich Auffälligkeiten, entsprechend an deine Führungskraft.
Zum Anderem unterstützt du auf täglicher Basis die Implementierung neuer Systeme und Prozesse, entlang unserer Arbeitsabläufe und versuchst sinnvolle als auch nachhaltige Lösungswege im Rahmen unserer Geschäftsziele zu erarbeiten.
Bei der Umsetzung der oben genannten Ziele, arbeitest du mit Soft- und Hardware-Lösungen für optimale Effizienz und Effektivität. In den dir unterstellten Teams achtest du darauf, dass alle Mitarbeiter über ausreichende und passende Hilfsmittel für die ihnen zugewiesenen Aufgaben und Rollen verfügen, mit dem übergeordneten Ziel der erfolgreichen Auftragsabwicklung und trägst somit maßgeblich zur Zufriedenheit unserer Kunden bei.

title: Reliability Maintenance Engineering Area Manager (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
We Pioneer.
Ein Tag, den ersten Schritt zu tun. Ein Tag, sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen. Und heute könnte der Tag sein, an dem Sie selbst Teil einer großen Idee werden. Ein Tag, an dem Sie Ihre eigenen Ideen verwirklichen können. Kommen Sie zu einem Unternehmen, das sich jeden Tag neu erfindet. Bei Amazon zu arbeiten, ist immer wieder aufregend.

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Brieselang suchen wir einen

Reliability Maintenance Engineering Area Manager (m/w/d)
(Reliability Maintenance Engineering Area Manager) (Fachrichtungen: Automatisierungstechnik / Elektrotechnik / Verfahrenstechnik / Maschinenbau)

Als Technischer Abteilungsleiter Instandhaltung (m/w) sind Sie verantwortlich für den kompletten technischen Bereich eines Logistikzentrums. Sie führen Instandhaltungsteams und sorgen zusammen mit diesen für den reibungslosen Ablauf und verbesserte Verfügbarkeit der förder- und gebäudetechnischen Anlagen. Sie koordinieren und optimieren Produktionsabläufe und tragen zu einer sicheren Arbeitsumgebung bei. Sie sind verantwortlich, dass alle Prüfungen und Instandhaltungen fristgerecht durchgeführt werden.

Ihre Herausforderung:

· Disziplinarische und fachliche Leitung des jeweiligen Teams.
· Gestalten von Trainings- und Entwicklungsplänen für Ihre Mitarbeiter.
· Mitentwickeln und Durchführen von technischen Projekten.
· Störungsbeseitigung aller automatisierten Sortier- und Fördersysteme, Flurförderfahrzeuge sowie gebäudetechnischen Anlagen.
· Schwachstellenanalyse und Durchführung von Maßnahmen zur Optimierung oben genannter Anlagen.
· Entwickeln/Nachhalten von Wartungs- und Instandhaltungsplänen.
· Planung und Einhaltung des Instandhaltungsbudgets.
· Betreuen der externen Dienstleister.
· Einhaltung aller Sicherheitsregeln auch für das Team gewährleisten.
· Einleitung von Analysen sowie Stress- und Verfügbarkeitstests der Anlagen.
· Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Businesspartnern.

title: Health and Safety Coordinator (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Here at Amazon we are currently looking for a WHS Health and Safety Coordinator (m/w/d) to join the team and play a critical role in coordinating and supporting the health and safety within Amazon Transportation. The successful candidate will identify, coordinate and drive improvements in operations safety, quality and productivity, working with the Operations Management teams to continuously improve the functionality and level of service that the site provides to our customers.

The Health and Safety Coordinator role is an excellent opportunity to get a start in safety in Amazon at our Hannover, Berlin, Nuremberg, Frankfurt, Dusseldorf, Cologne, Witten, Kassel, Munich, Leipzig Locations.

The Health & Safety Coordinator will be responsible for :

· Assisting with risk assessments and ensure follow up control measures to actioned and complete
· Act as an advisor for associates and managers on company health and safety procedures as well as legal requirements to comply with
· Monitoring the air hub to ensure we comply to company safety procedures and to identify risks and opportunity areas
· Assist with the investigation of incidents to establish root cause and develop a relevant action plans to follow up on it
· Keep diligently updated our internal records with regards to incidents, near misses and accidents
· Collate and produce a variety of weekly safety reports
· Attend health and safety meetings on a frequent basis
· Undertake projects and information gathering to establish hazards and level of risk within the delivery station
· Be involved in undertaking action plans to ensure continuing compliance with Legislation
· Monitor vehicle safety both related to transportation trucks and airplanes
· Support business across all shifts and days as applicable
· Carry out training sessions for managers and associates as required
· Responsible for emergency response and managing the first aid facilities

title: System Support Engineer
description:
DESCRIPTION
Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to any of these and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers that work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even image yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.

The scope of Amazon Robotics (AR) is expanding to include support of exciting new robotics technology being developed by teams across Amazon. A group of experienced and entrepreneurial minded Engineers and Support Managers is being assembled to create the new Emerging Technology Services (ETS) Team that will partner with product development teams, operations leaders, and maintenance teams to support advanced robotics technology across Amazon's fulfillment network.

We are seeking exceptional candidates for our Berlin location, who possess a blend of technical and customer-facing skills to successfully support Amazon’s Robotic Fulfillment Systems. This job will require a unique combination of flexibility, troubleshooting, creativity, leadership skills and drive. As part of this highly visible team, candidates have the opportunity to work cross-functionally with multiple international teams within Amazon to contribute to the continuous innovation of the Amazon’s robotics technology.

A successful candidate will have a consulting aptitude, strong ownership, passion and love for software and operational troubleshooting, customer-facing skills, and a desire to work within an elite group at the leading edge of Amazon's robotic fulfillment system operations.

Shift: Monday through Friday, 6am to 3pm

Job Responsibilities:
· Collaborate with Software, Hardware and System Performance Engineering teams to problem-solve critical software production issues
· Work with Fulfillment Center (FC) Operations team to provide technical guidance and troubleshoot operational challenges
· Develop training documentation and mentor other team members
· Driving the development of automation tools to reduce failures and manual task execution, therefore improving overall application performance and availability
· Have the ability to resolve critical incidents/problems and fluently applies escalation and notification procedures to leadership
· Document specific techniques for incident/problem resolution that will enable proactive system management
· Own and drive Root Case Analysis (RCA) on complex system issues

title: Technical Support Manager (Robotics)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Are you inspired by invention? Is problem solving through teamwork in your DNA? Do you like the idea of seeing how your work impacts the bigger picture? Answer yes to these questions and you’ll fit right in here at Amazon Robotics. We are a smart team of doers who work passionately to apply cutting edge advances in robotics and software to solve real-world challenges that will transform our customers’ experiences in ways we can’t even image yet. We invent new improvements every day. We are Amazon Robotics and we will give you the tools and support you need to invent with us in ways that are rewarding, fulfilling and fun.

Amazon Robotics is looking for a driven, entrepreneurial individual to lead a software support team ensuring high availability and stability across our Amazon Robotics network. He or she will leverage key relationships across the organization from software, QA, systems engineering, hardware engineering and warehouse operations teams. This leader will optimize day-to-day operations by effectively managing a high performing team, and continuously optimize and scale to support an ever changing landscape of software functionality and architecture. In addition, this leader needs to be highly innovative, constantly looking for new ways to decrease Fulfillment Center downtime and keep Fulfillment centers stable.

title: Senior DevOps Consultant
description:
DESCRIPTION
Do you want to transform industrial manufacturing and supply chain logistics? Do you want to help customers adopt industrial software solutions that integrate with plant environments, and to exchange data that enriches those solutions?

At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical computing architects to bring AWS cloud technologies to industrial manufacturing. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects and lead implementation projects. You will take advantage of the global scale, elasticity, automation and high-availability features of the AWS platform. You will build customer solutions with API Gateway, Lambda, DynamoDB, CloudWatch, ECS/EKS, GreenGrass, SiteWise Edge and other AWS services. You will help our customers implement DevOps to optimize software development processes and accelerate innovation. You will collaborate across a range of technical areas, including building scalable and resilient cloud infrastructure, automation, continuous integration and deployment, testing, observability, and security. You will apply your deep technical expertise to solve cloud-based solutions at scale. You will lead customers through transforming their business with the combination of cultural philosophies, practices, and tools that deliver end-to-end infrastructure solutions and applications.

The Senior DevOps Architect is a leader with extensive automation and programming experience throughout the software development lifecycle (SDLC). A successful DevOps Architect has technical depth across the full DevOps spectrum along with leading and evangelizing transformations, and driving innovation.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed

title: Snr Business Intelligence Engineer
description:
DESCRIPTION
Do you want to be part of the next big thing when it is still Day 0?

Our team aims to help achieve Amazon’s mission: to be Earth's Most Customer-Centric Company! We relentlessly focus on the customer experience and drive change across all of Amazon including Video, Alexa, Seller, and Retail.

As part of this mission, we are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer to be part of building and scaling a new global service focused on marketing insights. You will dive deep into ambiguous and complex issues, starting with social media and how to better understand and grow customer engagement. You will deliver results based on analyzing, evaluating and surfacing opportunities with your cross-disciplined team to senior leadership globally.

The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of different business and the underlying analytics, and the ability to translate business requirements into analysis, collect and analyse data, and make recommendations back to the business. BIEs also continuously learn new systems, tools, and industry best practices to help design new studies and build new tools that help our team automate, and accelerate analytics.

Are you up for the challenge? #Letsdothis

title: Database Migration Specialist
description:
DESCRIPTION
Migration Specialist – AWS Database Services – Migration as a Service

External job description
The Cloud is where it’s at – this goes without saying. Enterprises of all shapes and sizes are moving to the cloud and they need your help to do it. If you want to help migrate companies to the cloud while providing input on the products and services needed to enable this mass migration – read on. This is no small challenge as you’ll be helping large customers get a great start on their cloud migration journey. You’ll use your experience and real-world know how to help build proof of concept projects for customers and develop their own migration center of excellence teams. If you’re interested in having a measurable impact on businesses ranging from educations institutions through to multi-national corporations – this is the role for you. We are looking for talented migration specialists/architects that are passionate about databases and data warehouses, and are enthusiastic about applying bold new ideas to real-world problems. You will be forward-looking and aware of the latest DB technology offerings (including both relational and NoSQL), and migration methodologies. Databases Services at AWS covers a range of data platforms including Amazon Aurora, DynamoDB, Redshift, Athena, as well as AWS Database Migration Service, Data Pipeline, Glue and more. As each service grows, so does adoption by customers world-wide. You will be responsible for implementing a program which merges all the service content, programs, and processes to drive migrations to the cloud. Joining the AWS Database Services team as migration specialist on the MaaS team gives you the opportunity to:

• Engage with companies in a diverse range of industries and verticals.

• Solve challenging problems that will revolutionize computing in the cloud.

• Work for a company that’s at the forefront of the cloud computing space.

• Be involved in the fast growing managed services space – learn from the experts.

• Join the team whose activities are regularly called out publicly by our CEO.

In this position you will deal with demanding customers and pressing deadlines – but that just keeps things interesting. You’ll have exceptional problem solving skills, strong business judgment, and demonstrated experience working with cross-functional teams. You should have proven ability to execute both strategically and tactically, and be excited to take on new, ambiguous projects that will be industry defining. This position requires a solid technical background, and you should be customer-focused with a passion for the cloud and information technology. You should have deep understanding at least one of Oracle or SQL Server, Sybase, DB2, Teradata, Netezza or Greenplum databases, and knowledge of PostgreSQL, MySQL, or AWS native database engines is highly desirable. Past experience in migration technologies is a plus, but not required. Specific responsibilities include the following:

• Working with customers, AWS sales, professional services, solution architects and product teams to drive migrations.

• Assisting with the execution of migration discovery workshops with the largest enterprise customers.

• Building out proof of concept migration projects including database and application migration.

• Identifying technical solutions to migration obstacles while ensuring appropriate resources including training and support are available as required.

• Research and identify new opportunities for AWS to innovate on behalf of our customers.

• Operate test environment in cloud, run and analyze test results, perform diagnostics and troubleshooting, open, prioritize, and help triage defects, track and report test status and results.

• Helping customers migrate legacy database and application workloads between database engines.

Note: Extensive travel will be required


Our team puts a high value on work-live balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life.
