- Support the Launch & Expansion Program Managers or other involved teams in negotiations with permitting authorities and local political stakeholders when required with a focus on operational requirements and constraints
- Be the primary point of contact for AMZL Ops Leadership and Station Managers when it comes to restrictions by operating permit and support Ops teams how to mitigate existing constraints
- Support local/regional Operations Management and teams involved in the launch of a delivery station as required.
- Prepare and conduct post mortem reviews with AMZL Ops leaders (Regional Director, Senior Operations Manager and Delivery Station Manager) related to launches of new delivery stations

This is an MEU based role that will require frequent travel. The successful candidate will need to have physical on-site presence during launch phases throughout the entire region (East Germany)

title: Investigation Specialist
description:
DESCRIPTION
Each day, hundreds of thousands of customers make billions of transactions worldwide on our cloud. They are harnessing the power of Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enable innovative applications, websites, and businesses. However, there are always a few people that try to take unfair advantage of a good thing...

Are you interested in taking your skills and career to the next level, while having fun and fighting fraud in the cloud? Join a growing world class team to conduct investigations in order to prevent malicious and fraudulent usage on AWS.

You will be an integral member of a team of investigators, analysts and specialists conducting complex investigations of fraud activity. You will help drive related intelligence initiatives targeting new and emerging fraud threats to AWS. You will leverage your analytical and data skills to deep dive on a myriad of fraud activity to help drive complex investigations and investigative strategies. You will be at the forefront of keeping abreast of trends and fraud issues impacting the Cloud industry to ensure AWS is leading the curve in identifying, mitigating and preventing fraud attacks.

AWS is seeking dedicated, hardworking, analytical candidates with a proven track record of performance and results-oriented thinking, to join the AWS Fraud Investigations Team. Investigators will be responsible for a wide range of duties related to the investigation and mitigation of fraud in the Cloud. Ideal applicants will have experience in the Cloud industry, previous fraud experience, and proven success in a customer-driven workplace.

All candidates will be analytical and capable of succeeding in a fast-paced team environment. The Investigation Specialist position entails shift work, potentially evenings and Saturdays. Specific shift requirements to be based on needs of the business. This position relies on judgment to plan and accomplish goals with nearly all decisions expected to be made independently with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail. Individual problem-solving and analytical skills are used to authenticate customers’ cloud computing behavior and complex transactions on AWS accounts.

Responsibilities include:
· Conduct complex and deep dive investigations of sophisticated criminals and criminal enterprises
· Use a combination of manual and automated tools to gather data and conduct ad-hoc investigations
· Work with cross-functional teams across Amazon for collaboration on fraud risks and investigations
· Work with stakeholders to drive process improvements that will impact internal and external customers
· Maintain the confidentiality of all information obtained during the investigations process
· Take on ad-hoc projects/assignments related to fraud investigations as necessary

title: Germany Marketing Manager Ring
description:
DESCRIPTION
Ring is looking for an experienced and well-rounded marketing manager to lead our marketing strategy and communications in Germany. The role requires an in-depth knowledge and understanding of the German marketplace and proven track record of implementing successful campaigns.

You will connect with our central marketing team in Amsterdam to craft a compelling communications proposition and create best in class messaging for Ring. You will play a crucial role defining our target audience and will be a link between the marketplace, teams at Amazon and our HQ marketing teams (in content & production, acquisition, CRM and other).

This is an exciting opportunity to shape and build brand awareness of Ring in Germany. The right candidate will be a proactive self-starter who thrives on solving complex challenges. You are passionate about what you do and you have fun while doing it. This role is based in Munich/Berlin and will be reporting directly into the Marketing Director.

Responsibilities
· The single threaded owner of marketing for Germany supported by the central marketing team
· Responsible for Ring's marketing strategy across our product suite (doorbells, cameras, alarm) to deliver high performance and brand KPIs
· Owns brand marketing strategy, leading the development of new, integrated brand campaigns for Ring in Germany while partnering with our production and brand teams in Amsterdam and Santa Monica
· Owns and develops the communication strategy across all channels
· Partners and collaborates closely with central team in Amsterdam on acquisition channels, CRM, content & production and research
· Works with research resources from HQ and Amazon to develop a deep understanding of the German marketplace and Ring customer
· Works closely with partner agencies (media, creative and production) to oversee execution
· Manages local marketing partnerships and works closely with retail and B2B teams to ensure close collaboration and best in class customer experience
· Collaborates closely with Amazon to connect all points across the customer journey

title: HR Administrator (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
HR Administrator (m/w/d)

Die Pay Services Organisation spielt eine tragende Rolle in der Unterstützung der gesamten HR Organisation und der damit verbundenen Stakeholder wie Operations, Customer Service und Corporate.
Hauptaufgabe von Pay Services ist, alle administrativen, personalspezifischen Prozesse exakt, pünktlich und professionell ablaufen zu lassen. Der Fokus liegt dabei immer auf einer reibungslosen Lohnabrechnung sowie anderen administrativen Prozessen im Personalbereich.

Deine Aufgaben:
· Pflege und Überprüfung von Daten in unserem Zeiterfassungssystem inkl. Stempelzeiten, Urlaubs- und Krankenzeiten und Arbeitszeitkonten.
· Eingabe, Überprüfung und Pflege aller personenbezogenen und abrechnungsrelevanten Daten in unserem Personalinformationssystem.
· Vorbereitung und termingenaue Bereitstellung von Daten zur Weiterbearbeitung durch die zentrale Lohnabrechnung.
· Erstellung, Nachhalten und Kontrolle von Auswertungen und Statistiken.
· Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Sozialversicherungsträgern und Ämtern zum Thema Lohnfortzahlung und Klärung von allgemeinen sozialversicherungsrechtlichen Fragen.
· Selbständige Anfertigung aller anfallenden Bescheinigungen und Arbeitspapiere (u.a. Zeugnisse, Urlaubsbescheinigungen).

title: Manager, Customer Service Compliance
description:
DESCRIPTION
At Amazon.com, we strive to be Earth’s most customer-centric company. To support this vision, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you would like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to work hard, have fun, and make history.

The World Wide Customer Service (CS) organization is a seeking a manager to join the CS Compliance team and validate compliance to policies, procedures and contractual requirements associated with operations, administration, and technology at captive and third party contact centers. As a Compliance Manager you will partner with key members of Operations, Technology, Security, Legal, and Social Responsibility to outline program requirements, set the audit schedule, and design and execute risk assessments. You will provide consultative support to business partners to identify opportunities for control improvements with the objective of mitigating risk and improving compliance and operational performance. The Compliance Manager will also work closely with the regional account management teams to create an education program and self-assessment model, as well as address gaps identified through the assessment process. You will be an effective leader known for diving deep into subject matter, taking ownership for unmitigated risks, and encouraging innovative and pragmatic solutions to complex problems. In addition, you will have solid business judgment, strong controllership focus, executive presence, and the capability to drive a fast-paced organization to the right results.

Among other responsibilities you will:
• Plan, scope, and perform comprehensive compliance audits across the CS network.
• Deliver recommendations and risk interpretations in a clear, concise and audience-specific format. Develop actions for remediation of audit findings, track status and collect evidence to support closure of each action.
• Define and build program requirements and documentation standards.
• Collaborate with internal partners to develop and deliver training reflective of the unique risks and operating environment associated with captive, virtual, and outsourced CS sites.
• Work with account management teams to create program success and compliance metrics
• Serve as a subject matter expert for stakeholder groups with respect to Amazon information security, physical security, and social responsibility policies, procedures, and contractual requirements
• Leverage domain expertise and collaborate with internal leaders to identify new/emerging risks and modify the compliance program scope appropriately to test associated controls.

title: Sr. Database Migration Specialist
description:
DESCRIPTION
The Cloud is where it’s at – this goes without saying. Enterprises of all shapes and sizes are moving to the cloud and they need your help to do it. If you want to help migrate companies to the cloud while providing input on the products and services needed to enable this mass migration – read on.

This is no small task, as you’ll be helping large customers get a great start on their cloud migration journey. You’ll use your experience and real-world know how to help build proof of concept projects for customers and develop their own migration center of excellence teams. If you’re interested in having a measurable impact on businesses ranging from educations institutions through to multi-national corporations – this is the role for you.
We are looking for talented migration specialists/architects that are passionate about databases and data warehouses, and are enthusiastic about applying bold new ideas to real-world problems. You will be forward-looking and aware of the latest DB technology offerings (including both relational and NoSQL), and migration methodologies.
Databases Services at AWS covers a range of data platforms including Amazon Aurora, DynamoDB, Redshift, Athena, as well as AWS Database Migration Service, Data Pipeline, Glue and more. As each service grows, so does adoption by customers world-wide. You will be dealing with implementing programs which merge all the service content, programs, and processes to drive migrations to the cloud.

Joining the AWS Database Services team as migration specialist on the MaaS team gives you the opportunity to:

• Engage with companies in a diverse range of industries and verticals.
• Solve complex problems that will revolutionize computing in the cloud.
• Work for a company that’s at the forefront of the cloud computing space.
• Be involved in the fast growing managed services space – learn from the experts.
• Join the team whose activities are regularly called out publicly by our CEO.

In this position you will deal with demanding customers and pressing deadlines – but that just keeps things interesting. You’ll have exceptional problem solving skills, strong business judgment, and demonstrated experience working with cross-functional teams. You should have proven ability to execute both strategically and tactically, and be excited to take on new, ambiguous projects that will be industry defining. This position requires a solid technical background, and you should be customer-focused with a passion for the cloud and information technology. Specific ownership includes the following:

• Working with customers, AWS sales, professional services, solution architects and product teams to drive migrations.
• Assisting with the execution of migration discovery workshops with the largest enterprise customers.
• Building out proof of concept migration projects including database and application migration.
• Identifying technical solutions to migration obstacles while ensuring appropriate resources including training and assistance are available as required.
• Research and identify new opportunities for AWS to innovate on behalf of our customers.
• Operate test environment in cloud, run and analyze test results, perform diagnostics and troubleshooting, open, prioritize, and help triage defects, track and report test status and results.

We are recruiting for these roles in multiple locations including The Netherlands, Luxembourg, United Kingdom, France, Switzerland, Sweden, Norway, Finland or Denmark!

title: Carrier Operations Specialist
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon opened its virtual doors in 1995 and strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything they might want to buy online.

Amazon is currently looking for a highly motivated, forward-thinking Transportation Program Manager to join the Transportation team.

The role represents a critical function with Amazon EU Operations to continuously improve the service levels, capacities, and costs of the EU Transportation Line Haul to ensure promises to the customers are being maintained.

Your team's responsibilities:
- Develop relationships with Line Haul providers that facilitate communication and visibility across Amazon’s line haul network
- sourcing potential carriers in order to increase our partners portfolio through cold-calls, email and any other available source of communication
- communicating potential supplier and sharing information about cooperation with Amazon
- instructing carrier about Amazon’s requirements towards carrier
- introducing and inviting carrier to the platform with Amazon loads
- looking for out of box ideas of sourcing perfect supplier
- Track existing metrics to detect & remove defects
- Continuous Improvement Management with carriers, development of SOPs
- Analyze existing trucking versus required capacity, especially to support peak
- Support market research, Request for Information, Request for Quotation process to source new carriers where the existing carrier pool is insufficient/poor performing
- Project support ensuring Amazon requirements are communicated & executed by Line Haul carriers
- Support Contract management and contract compliance for existing and new routes/carrier
- Support truck forecast improvement initiatives and ensure it is shared with carriers and Fulfillment Centers on a regular basis
- Recommend Line Haul carrier allocation to routes/replacements (based on optimum of cost and performance)
- Q4 planning and execution - secure sufficient Q4 Line Haul
- Support the Operations Planning (OP) Process: goal settings
- Prepare and participate recurrent Ops calls, business reviews, QBRs, Customer Service workshops (to support the improvement plans)
- Maintain and improve communication, process and Fulfillment Center/carrier interface


To be successful in this role, you need a passion for making data driven decisions which will have direct impact on customer experience. Some keys to your success are the ability to be an effective communicator to various audiences. The ability to remain flexible and adapt to learning new tools and systems is instrumental in your role. Our environment is deadline driven, fast paced, and requires you to be detail-oriented and comfortable interacting and working with multiple teams (business and technical).


The position is based in the vibrant city of Munich, Germany.

title: Senior Manager, Solutions Architecture, AWS Game Tech - EMEA
description:
DESCRIPTION
Behind great games, there’s game tech.
Games live at the intersection of technology and the arts, and with more than 2.5 billion people playing games every day, there’s never been a more exciting time to make games. At AWS Game Tech, our mission is to help developers build amazing, fun, and successful games, and we strive to power every game with AWS.
Would you like to build a team focused on helping game developers, studios, and publishers in EMEA build the best games possible? As a Senior Manager with AWS Game Tech, you will build and lead our technical go-to-market strategy in partnership with sales, marketing, and business development. Your team will drive AWS adoption within the most creative, impactful, and innovative games makers on the planet, and your team will address some of the most compelling technical challenges for games touching billions of players globally.
Your responsibilities will include hiring and developing a team of exceptional technologists focused on the games industry throughout EMEA. You will attract the best talent to AWS Game Tech, building and coaching a direct-line team of Solutions Architects to help customers build with AWS. You will collaborate with leaders focused on early stage customer engagement, sales, and field marketing resources to ensure Game Tech functions are aligned with the commercial team’s strategy to power every game with AWS.
You will also establish relationships with key executive stakeholders in the most strategic publishers, studios, and companies in EMEA. You will represent the business to AWS and customer executive leadership, collaborate with international AWS Game Tech senior and executive leadership, and become a trusted senior leader to your team and AWS customers. You will set a vision, build a team, and establish a customer-obsessed culture of experimentation and technical excellence that is instrumental to helping game devs use the cloud to make fun, successful games powered by AWS. Your leadership will ensure AWS Game Tech customers have the technical and architectural support they need to be successful.
The ideal candidate will possess a technical leadership background that enables them to interact impactfully at the CTO/CIO/SVP level. They will also have strong, demonstrated technical skills that allows them to effectively engage with other technical customer stakeholders and convey technical concepts in detail. They will be able to think strategically and analytically, communicating compelling value propositions for customers and partners. They will have a passion for new and emerging technologies, and the ambition to shape the future to benefit customers. They will have familiarity with core games industry vernacular and business processes and, perhaps most importantly, they will love games.
Roles & Responsibilities:
· Hire, develop, and lead a team of exceptional technologists in the field
· Operate at an executive level with diligence, focus, and maintain a strong operational rigour
· Establish strategic relationships with Amazon and AWS technical and business oriented executive stakeholders globally
· Establish strategic, technical, and business relationships as an executive sponsor to game developers, studios, publishers, and other key stakeholders in EMEA in order to drive cloud adoption
· Prepare and deliver data-driven business reviews to senior management and executive leadership about progress, achievements, and roadblocks in the games business
· Develop and Execute strategic initiatives for AWS Game Tech, while collaborating with key internal stakeholders internationally

title: Teamleiter Amazon Air (m/w/d) - Schkeuditz
description:
DESCRIPTION
Möchten Sie Teil unsers Teams am Flughafen Leipzig-Halle werden?


Amazon erweitert die Kapazitäten am Flughafen Leipzig-Halle. Dazu wurde im Südteil des Geländes neben dem bestehenden World Cargo Center eine rund 20.000 Quadratmeter große Frachthalle errichtet. Mit dem Ausbau entstanden zusätzliche Arbeitsplätze für die wir nun qualifizierte Mitarbeiter suchen. Das Ziel der Erweiterung sind bessere Abläufe beim Verladen der Sendungen. Amazon investiert und forscht weiter, um Kunden ein größeres Angebot und flexiblere Lieferoptionen zu einem besseren Preis anbieten zu können.

Schau hinter die Kulissen eines Amazon Air Standorts:
https://blog.aboutamazon.com/transportation/how-to-pack-a-prime-plane

Wir suchen ab sofort mehrere Teamleiter Transport (m/w/d) am Flughafen Halle/Leipzig in Schkeuditz

Unser Amazon Air Team wächst! Wenn Du Teil eines Unternehmens werden möchtest, wo du etwas Bedeutendes bewegen kannst, Spaß hast, Erfolge feierst und ein Lächeln auf die Gesichter unserer Kunden zauberst, dann ist diese Stelle die richtige für Dich!
Als Teamleiter Transport? spielst du eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Bearbeitung unserer Kundenaufträge. Du arbeitest eng mit dem Schichtleiterteam auf der Fläche zusammen, um für reibungslose operative Abläufe an unseren Logistikstandorten zu sorgen. Dazu zählen unsere Logistikzentren, wo die Ware auf Kundenbestellung wartet, unsere Sortierzentren, die Pakete für die weitere Verteilung an die Zustellungsdienste sortieren, sowie unsere Verteilzentren die für die letzten Kilometer bis zur Haustür des Kunden zuständig sind.

Wir möchten, dass unsere Teams zusammenarbeiten, Sachen machen, und sich nicht mit dem Status quo zufriedengeben. Jeder Tag ist bei uns anders, was stets für neue Herausforderungen und Abwechslung sorgt!

Du wirst…
- Darauf achten, dass Sicherheitsstandards eingehalten werden und stets auf dem neusten Stand sind und damit eine sichere Arbeitsumgebung schaffen
- Sicherstellen, dass Kundenbestellungen gemäß unseren Qualitäts- und Sicherheitsstandards bearbeitet werden
- Unsere Versand- und-Sortiermitarbeiter motivieren, schulen, die Aufgabenverteilung während deiner Schichten anpassen und in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Schichtleiterteam erste Führungsaufgaben übernehmen
- Durchgängig relevante Informationen und Kennzahlen auswerten und an das Management-Team weitergeben
- Mit internen und externen Kollegen zusammenarbeiten (z.B. aus dem Bereich HR, Customer Service, Transport)
- Prozesse auswerten, optimieren und Innovationen vorantreiben

title: Key Account Manager (m/w/d) PanEuropäischer Versand
description:
DESCRIPTION

Come build the future with us.


Amazon ist eine der führenden e-Commerce-Plattformen weltweit. Mehr als zwei Millionen Verkäufer, darunter Kleinunternehmen, Mittelständler und weltbekannte Handelsmarken nutzen die verschiedenen Verkäufer-Services von Amazon. Sie vergrößern damit ihren Erfolg und erreichen neue Kunden sowohl bei Amazons Marktplätzen als auch im eigenen Online-Shop. Werden Sie Teil dieser internationalen Erfolgsgeschichte und starten Sie Ihre Karriere bei Amazon!
Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Versand durch Amazon-Teams suchen wir Key Account Manager (m/w/d) im Bereich Europäischer Versand.
Versand durch Amazon bietet Händlern, die bereits bei Amazon.de verkaufen, die Möglichkeit, ihre Waren direkt von Amazon versenden zu lassen. Damit profitieren diese Händler nicht nur von Amazons Logistik-Expertise. Weil Kunden Amazons schnellen und zuverlässigen Versand besonders schätzen, eröffnen sich teilnehmenden Händlern gleichzeitig auch neue Umsatzchancen.
Ihre Aufgabe als Key Account Manager PanEU ist es, Händler für Versand durch Amazon zu gewinnen, sie beim Start dieses Services zu begleiten und auch anschließend zu betreuen. Darüber hinaus arbeiten Sie aktiv in Projekten mit anderen Kollegen und Teams zusammen.
Ihre Aufgaben:

·
· Sie gewinnen Händler für die Seller Prime Services (FBA/Paneuropäischer Versand) und bauen die Nutzung der Services national und international aus.
·
· Sie helfen Händlern weitere Potentiale zu erkennen und auf der Amazon Plattform zu wachsen, um unsere relevante Selektion für Kunden zu erweitern.
·
· Sie analysieren und entwickeln die Zusammenarbeit mit Ihren Händlern durch detaillierte Auswertungen und Handlungsempfehlungen, mit dem Ziel die Geschäfte des Händlers auf den europäischen Amazon-Marktplätzen auf- und auszubauen
·
· Sie koordinieren die Integration von Versand durch Amazon in Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Logistikspezialisten.
·
· Sie arbeiten in verschiedenen Projekten eng mit europäischen Kollegen aus anderen Verkäufer-Services sowie mit Kollegen aus dem Amazons Retail-Team und dem operativen Logistik-Management zusammen. Sie helfen damit, interne Prozesse und Versand durch Amazon weiterzuentwickeln, um Online-Händler noch besser unterstützen zu können.

title: Content Strategist and Developer, EU Heavy/Bulky & Services
description:
DESCRIPTION
The EU Heavy/Bulky & Services team (HBS) is building a world-class shopping experience for heavy, bulky, and high consideration purchases (TVs, furniture, refrigerators, and more).

We are currently looking for a Content Strategist and Developer to join the HBS team. The position will be responsible for planning, creating, and delivering help content both to external customers on our website, as well as internal Customer Service Associates across our five EU marketplaces (UK, DE, FR, IT, ES). The position can be based in our offices in Munich, Milano, Paris or Madrid.

In this position, you will act as the ‘voice of Amazon’ and will be responsible for all customer-facing and internal documentation, including but not limited to online Help pages and Knowledge Centre documentation for Customer Service Associates. You will support the fast-paced roll out of HBS initiatives across EU, ranging from new Service offerings to improved Return processes, by developing help pages and customer service policies and procedures. In this position, you will have a significant impact on Customer Experience in the HBS product segment.

To excel in this position, you will be comfortable in a fast-paced, high-energy environment. You must be used to dealing with tight deadlines and internal stakeholders, and have a proactive approach to problem solving. You will have experience digging into data to discover pain points and developing content strategy that solves those problems. And, most importantly, you have deep expertise in help and support content, including writing, production, and strategy.

Key Responsibilities:
· Drive content projects for their entire lifecycle from planning through post-launch measurement
· Find and execute strategies to improve content accessibility, quality, maintainability, and usability
· Continually assess the tools, technology and processes used for content management, with full responsibility for change management when needed
· Build and leverage strong relationships with multiple stakeholders to deliver complex, global projects
· Use a combination of data analysis, user research, benchmarking, and content audits to make content decisions and orchestrate content development

title: Trainer/in (m/w)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Wir glauben, dass bei Amazon jeder Tag "Day One" ist.
Ein Tag, den ersten Schritt zu tun. Ein Tag, sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen. Und heute könnte der Tag sein, an dem Sie selbst Teil einer großen Idee werden. Ein Tag, an dem Sie Ihre eigenen Ideen verwirklichen können. Kommen Sie zu einem Unternehmen, das sich jeden Tag neu erfindet. Bei Amazon zu arbeiten, ist immer wieder aufregend.
Ziel von Amazon ist es seit jeher, das kundenorientierteste Unternehmen der Welt zu werden. Beliefert werden unsere Kunden von unseren Distributionszentren u.a. in Bad Hersfeld, Graben, Leipzig, Rheinberg, Werne, Koblenz und Pforzheim.

Zur Unterstützung unseres Training Teams in unserem Logistikzentrum in Leipzig suchen wir ab dem 01.02.2021 zwei

Trainer/in (m/w/d) in Wechselschicht

Als Trainer/in sind Sie für die Einarbeitung, Aus- und Weiterbildung aller Versandmitarbeiter verantwortlich. Dazu gehört auch Wissenssicherung der internen Abläufe mit dem Ziel, Sicherheit, Qualität, Leistung und damit die Kundenzufriedenheit zu fördern. Sie verfügen über ein umfassendes Wissen aller Abläufe und unterstützen unsere Logistikleiter durch die Erstellung und ständige Überprüfung von Prozessdokumentationen und Visualisierungen.
Der Einsatz als Trainer/in erfolgt im permanenten 2-Schicht-System, auf Vollzeitbasis.

Aufgabengebiete u.a.:
· Erstellen, aktualisieren und leiten von Seminare und Workshops für neue Mitarbeiter und Führungskräfte
· Betreuen, fördern und ausbilden von Fachtrainern (Instructors)
· Durchführen von internen Audits
· Konzeption und Schulung von technischen Abläufen
· Mitarbeit in Projekten
· Analytische und pädagogische Aufbereitung von „Best Practice“; Prozessentwicklungen und Umsetzung neuer Konzepte
· Teilnahme an internationalen Telefonkonferenzen mit Trainern aus anderen in- und ausländischen Niederlassungen

title: Enterprise Sales Specialist, AWS Quicksight
description:
DESCRIPTION
As the AWS Sales Organization continues to rapidly grow and expand our customer base, AWS is seeking a sales representative to help us establish AWS as the market leader for Business Intelligence and Data visualization service that addresses our customers' needs.

As a specialist sales representative for this fast growing and exciting space, you will have the opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of emerging technologies that will have a significant impact on our customer’s technical strategy. Your responsibilities will include driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration for the Amazon QuickSight service.

Are you a motivated self-starter with an analytical mind? Do you want to work on the forefront of the latest innovations and technologies? Do you seek the opportunity to work with a diverse set of customers, opportunities and markets as part of a team focused on increasing adoption of Amazon QuickSight service?


Come build the future with us.

title: Senior Expert Customs
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon is seeking an enthusiastic, customer-centric Customs Specialist for the Aviation Security Team to provide support and oversight for cargo transportation efforts within Amazon Air in regards to customs operations. You have the chance to work on the forefront of customs process innovation and can actively form and develop processes at a very early stage that are meant to scale!
The candidate will be responsible for developing and leading the site operations in regards to customs processes and performs standards by ensuring compliance with corporate policies, federal regulations, and standardized processes.

Responsibilities will also include regular communication with customs authorities, the external broker, track keeping of relevant KPI and reporting of such, as well as designing and developing processes and standards together with your manager.

The Customs Specialist will embrace Amazon’s core values and is excited about a unique opportunity to influence and support our growing Amazon Air network at a very early stage.
This key role will support the Amazon Air customs operations programs by understanding, implementing, and validating customs requirements to ensure our operations is secure and that the organization is prepared to properly respond to various emergencies. Applicants must have proven the ability to utilize processes to challenge conventional wisdom, think strategically, communicate effectively, deliver results, think innovatively and leverage the necessary technical support that will be provided by both Amazon and third-party technical experts.

As part of the Aviation Security team, the Customs Specialist will create, establish, and verify compliance with logistic procedures, regulatory standards and policies.
Other responsibilities include:
· Own customs processes at Amazon Air facility and develop and maintain relationships with regulatory partners.
· Work together with Amazon Air Operations teams from a customs perspective.
· Process information from various reporting tools to determine and avoid risks.
· Process KPI and reporting of such.
· Deep diving on package status, metrics and flows to maintain an in-depth understanding of how packages are processed within Amazon.
· Develop innovative ways together with your manager to operate customs within the Amazon Air network.
· Ensure the highest compliance levels for all customs and government agency requirements across all staff and teams.
· Escort customs authorities when inspecting packages and support with needed measures.
· Process invoices within the facility or externally towards local customs office.

title: Finance Manager - DE Financial Planning & Analysis
description:
DESCRIPTION
It’s still Day One at Amazon and it could be Day One for you to make new experiences, to become an active part of our story and to help building the most customer centric company on Earth. Join a company that is reinventing itself every day, continuously letting you learn and asking you to take personal ownership for your work and results.

To support our continued growth, Amazon is looking for a Finance Manager - DE Financial Planning & Analysis at our German headquarters in Munich. In this role you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our Retail business. You will co-own the results of the business in Germany, be responsible for key finance processes and help us to continue to develop our team. In this role you will lead a team and report to the Finance Director responsible for Germany.


Key Responsibilities:

· You help managing our German marketplace with weekly and monthly key performance indicators.
· You have the freedom and opportunity to consult, challenge and influence business decisions and drive our long-term free cash flow.
· You recruit, develop and lead your team to continuously raise the bar on its performance.
· You will consult with relevant business and finance teams across Europe and worldwide to benchmark, identify, and implement best practices.
· You are responsible for running and continuously enhancing the short- and mid- and longterm planning processes, month end closing and ensuring financial compliance.
· You strive to constantly improve our financial tools to take better and faster decisions.

title: Production Executive, Germany Local Original Movies m/f/d
description:
DESCRIPTION
Please submit your application in English.
This role could be based in either Berlin or Munich.

Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching? Prime Video is one of the leading digital video services on the Internet today, and we’re just getting started changing the way millions of people around the world enjoy content. Now available in more than 240 countries and territories, Prime Video offers customers the broadest selection of any on-demand video service, including our critically-acclaimed Amazon Originals Series such as the multi-award-winning The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Tom Clancy’s Jack Ryan, The Boys; Amazon Original hit series made in Germany like BEAT, Bibi & Tina, Deutschland89, Inside Borussia Dortmund, Pastewka, You Are Wanted, the forthcoming drama series Wir Kinder vom Bahnhof Zoo and the comedy show LOL: Last One Laughing; exclusive TV shows like Star Trek: Picard, American Gods and Vikings; and movies like Late Night and I Am Your Woman, plus live concerts and live sports including UEFA Champions League football.

Amazon Studios is the movies and television development and production arm of Amazon. It is our role to produce original content and license studio programs worldwide in exclusive service of Amazon’s Prime Video customers. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take us to new heights.

We are currently seeking an experienced Production Executive to aid Amazon Studios’ genre, scripted productions, co-productions, and licensed programs in Germany. The team will need your support across overseeing budgets, schedules, and overall productions for Amazon Studios. This role will work with Post-Production, Marketing, PR, Legal, and Business Affairs. You will be interacting with both internal and external stakeholders at the studio and show level.

Responsibilities
· Track and process approvals and production payments with Business Affairs, Legal and Finance.
· Oversees all Local Original Movies in Germany in development and production for scripted content.
· Ensures major milestones are met (e.g. budget lock, budget approval, kick of calls, deliverables etc.)
· Coordinate kick-off calls with development for each individual project.
· Meets with show producers, production managers and creative executives in regards to schedules, budget and all things production.
· Is on-set when necessary to evaluate work-flow, budgets and potential problems.
· Analyzes budgets and cost reports.
· Acts a liaison from producers to Head of Production for Local Original Movies at Amazon Studios.
· Will create and update production charts for projects in territory.

title: Corporate Counsel, Digital Music
description:
DESCRIPTION
Are you looking for a new challenge in a fast-paced, innovative company?

We are looking for a talented and experienced lawyer to support our quickly growing digital music business.

You will directly advise our digital music business in Germany and in the EU on all aspects of the business, and in particular on our music streaming services (e.g. Amazon Music Unlimited and Prime Music) including podcasts. Next to working on new initiatives, you will be the lead lawyer on strategic projects, providing day-to-day advice on a wide range of legal areas, notably content licensing, media law and regulatory compliance. You will take the lead in negotiating and drafting license and commercial agreements with external partners.

The position can be based in Berlin or Munich, and some international travel may be required.

title: EU Engineering Project Manager
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon is seeking an experienced and business oriented EU Engineering Project Manager to coordinate the planning and execution of highly complex logistic process automation and storage projects for the continued expansion of our EU fulfillment network.

Ideal candidates will be natural self-starters who have Engineering Program and Project Management experience combined with an established technical problem solving ability. The role will understand all aspects of an Amazon Fulfillment Center while focusing on its automation technologies (conveyance, sortation, robotics) and storage solutions. This person will be responsible for planning, designing and delivering state-of-the-art material handling systems and innovations while coordinating internal teams and external contractors in order to effectively launch new Fulfillment Centers and expansions in existing sites. Amazon’s culture encourages an entrepreneurial approach and expects engineers and managers alike to take a high level of ownership in solving complex problems in a fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities:
· End-to-end ownership for large-scale engineering projects (planning, design, installation, commissioning and qualification, launch support)
· Coordinate critical path items, dive deep on technical details and provide innovative solutions to resolve issues
· Assess and communicate project status, escalations on potential risks and delays across multiple teams
· Prepare and conduct weekly standing meetings with internal teams and external vendors/contractors to plan and track deliverables
· Create, submit and track the relevant CAPEX documentation to ensure that all projects are delivered within budget and best overall value
· Lead technical design reviews and propose design solutions for material handling and storage solutions that meet both business needs and global design standards
· Assist in providing equipment specifications and technical support to procurement and other business
· Collaborate closely with various internal teams such as World Wide Engineering, Construction, Operations, Reliability Maintenance Engineering, IT and Procurement

title: Senior Vendor Manager (m/w/d) Tools & Home Improvement (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon hat eine einfache Mission: Wir wollen der Ort sein, an dem Kunden alles online finden, entdecken und kaufen können. Was immer Kunden wollen – wir finden die Mittel und Wege, um es zu liefern. Seien Sie dabei, wenn wir Menschen dabei helfen, neue Welten zu entdecken - und Ideen Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen.
Blicken Sie mit uns in die Zukunft und verstärken Sie unser Team in München als

Senior Vendor Manager (m/w/d) – für den Geschäftsbereich Tools & Home Improvement (Baumarkt)

Sie bezeichnen sich als teamorientierte Persönlichkeit und trauen sich zu, die Einkaufsperformance Ihrer Produktlinie entscheidend zu verbessern. Innovationen vorantreiben, neue lukrative Lieferquellen erschließen, starke Lieferantenbeziehungen aufbauen: Das sind Ihre zentralen Themen.

Hierbei bringen Sie Ihre Stärken in der Lieferantensteuerung und Verhandlungsführung ebenso mit ein wir Ihre exzellenten analytischen Fähigkeiten, Ihr Projektmanagement-Know-how, Ihren ausgeprägten Geschäftssinn und Ihren unbändigen Willen, Amazon Kunden faszinierende Einkaufserlebnisse zu ermöglichen.

In Ihrer Rolle arbeiten Sie mit Lieferanten jeder Größe zusammen und vertreten Ihre Produktlinie auch intern energisch und kommunikationsstark.

Ihre Herausforderung:
Sie fungieren als Manager für Einkaufsbeziehungen – und noch viel mehr als das: nämlich auch als Lieferanten- und Projektmanager, Produktspezialist, Online-Marketingspezialist und Verkäufer in einer Person.

Als Unternehmer im Unternehmen beeinflussen Sie die Gestaltung Ihrer Kategorie, erkennen Trends, konzipieren Marketingaktionen, entwickeln neue Warengruppen, entwickeln Lieferantenbeziehungen und beschaffen Top-Produkte. Hierfür identifizieren Sie die Lieferanten und unterstützen die Vereinbarung der Rahmenkonditionen. Sie werden mehr Verantwortung tragen, mehr Lieferanten und Produkte betreuen und mehr Freiraum besitzen, als Sie es bisher gewohnt sind.

Konkret verantworten Sie auf dieser Position komplexe Lieferanten und Marken, die für den Bereich Baumarktvon strategischer Wichtigkeit sind. Sie entwickeln bestehende sowie neue Prozesse und setzen alles daran, das Kauferlebnis unserer Kunden durch besseren Service, breitere Produktvielfalt, günstigere Preise und höhere Verfügbarkeit zu verbessern. Die Performance Ihrer Produktkategorie bestimmt Ihren Erfolg. Als Ihr eigener Controller analysieren Sie relevante Kennzahlen inklusive Abverkauf, erstellen entsprechende Reports und überwachen erzielte Margen.

Sie arbeiten eng mit Ihren Kollegen aus Supply Chain Management, Product Management, Marketing, Category Management, Legal und Finance zusammen. Sie übernehmen die Führung bei spannenden Amazon-weiten Projekten und strategischen Rollen, die große Auswirkung auf Ihren Bereich und das Unternehmen haben.

title: Teamleiter Transport (m/w/d) -Oerlenbach
description:
DESCRIPTION
Unser Amazon Operations Team wächst! Wenn Du Teil eines Unternehmens werden möchtest, wo du etwas Bedeutendes bewegen kannst, Spaß hast, Erfolge feierst und ein Lächeln auf die Gesichter unserer Kunden zauberst, dann ist diese Stelle die richtige für Dich!
Als Teamleiter Logistik spielst du eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Bearbeitung unserer Kundenaufträge. Du arbeitest eng mit dem Schichtleiterteam auf der Fläche zusammen, um für reibungslose operative Abläufe an unseren Logistikstandorten zu sorgen. Dazu zählen unsere Logistikzentren, wo die Ware auf Kundenbestellung wartet, unsere Sortierzentren, die Pakete für die weitere Verteilung an die Zustellungsdienste sortieren, sowie unsere Verteilzentren die für die letzten Kilometer bis zur Haustür des Kunden zuständig sind.

Wir möchten, dass unsere Teams zusammenarbeiten, Sachen machen, und sich nicht mit dem Status quo zufriedengeben. Jeder Tag ist bei uns anders, was stets für neue Herausforderungen und Abwechslung sorgt!

Du wirst…

- Darauf achten, dass Sicherheitsstandards eingehalten werden und stets auf dem neusten Stand sind und damit eine sichere Arbeitsumgebung schaffen.
- Unsere Versand- und-Sortiermitarbeiter motivieren, schulen, die Aufgabenverteilung während deiner Schichten anpassen und in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Schichtleiterteam erste Führungsaufgaben übernehmen.
- Sicherstellen, dass Kundenbestellungen gemäß unseren Qualitäts- und Sicherheitsstandards bearbeitet werden.
- Durchgängig relevante Informationen und Kennzahlen auswerten und an das Management-Team weitergeben.
- Mit internen und externen Kollegen zusammenarbeiten (z.B. aus dem Bereich HR, Customer Service, Transport).
- Prozesse auswerten, optimieren und Innovationen vorantreiben.

title: Teamleiter Logistik (m/w/d) -Raum Bad Kissingen
description:
DESCRIPTION
Unser Amazon Operations Team wächst! Wenn Du Teil eines Unternehmens werden möchtest, wo du etwas Bedeutendes bewegen kannst, Spaß hast, Erfolge feierst und ein Lächeln auf die Gesichter unserer Kunden zauberst, dann ist diese Stelle die richtige für Dich!

Wir möchten, dass unsere Teams zusammenarbeiten, Sachen machen, und sich nicht mit dem Status quo zufriedengeben. Jeder Tag ist bei uns anders, was stets für neue Herausforderungen und Abwechslung sorgt!

Du wirst…

- Darauf achten, dass Sicherheitsstandards eingehalten werden und stets auf dem neusten Stand sind und damit eine sichere Arbeitsumgebung schaffen.
- Unsere Versand- und-Sortiermitarbeiter motivieren, schulen, die Aufgabenverteilung während deiner Schichten anpassen und in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Schichtleiterteam erste Führungsaufgaben übernehmen.
- Sicherstellen, dass Kundenbestellungen gemäß unseren Qualitäts- und Sicherheitsstandards bearbeitet werden.
- Durchgängig relevante Informationen und Kennzahlen auswerten und an das Management-Team weitergeben.
- Mit internen und externen Kollegen zusammenarbeiten (z.B. aus dem Bereich HR, Customer Service, Transport).
- Prozesse auswerten, optimieren und Innovationen vorantreiben.

title: Manager Merchant Services Paid Services (w/m/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Manager Merchant Services AMPS (m/w/d) – Munich

Background
Our vision is to make Amazon the best place for third party Selling Partners of all sizes to grow and serve customers, leveraging world-class tools and services. The Amazon Marketplace Professional Services (AMPS) team is seeking a Manager Merchant Services AMPS who is self-motivated, results-driven and capable of working in a dynamic environment. The role will be a manager of manager leading a team of of 17 including 2 Teamleads as well as 4-5 Marketplace Consultants. On top you further lead a number of EU wide projects. The role is based in Munich.

Amazon Marketplace Professional Services (AMPS) program seeks to improve the customer and Selling Partner experience on Amazon by working directly with Selling Partners to improve value, selection and convenience across their business. Our team will invent and innovate across technology, processes and people to grow the program, improve seller engagement and satisfaction and enable scalable global solutions through direct cooperation with the US, China and Japan Teams.

Roles and Responsibilities
· Hire top talent and support their professional development by identifying and creating opportunities for them to build their skill set.
· Build and deliver a strategy to meet your team level goals including Selling Partner satisfaction using our AMPS Playbooks, and continuously strive to improve your team’s productivity as they focus on supporting their own portfolio of Selling Partners achieve their growth goals by becoming experts of the Marketplace.
· Regularly audit key metrics to ensure your team is optimizing for Selling Partner growth and satisfaction.
· Listen to and conduct deep dives on challenges your team and their Selling Partners’ are facing and provide inputs to the Luxembourg Product Management teams to drive improvements within the AMPS Playbook.
· Become an expert on the AMPS Playbook and using that to help/coach your team member in the delivery of holistic account management services to the Selling Partners.
· You will also be responsible for managing complex account management issues and escalations at scale, and coaching your team to do the same.
· Grow and develop people into a talent pool for Amazon

As a Manager for AMPS, you will be responsible for developing and delivering a strategy to meet your team level goals including Selling Partner satisfaction goals, and continuously striving to improve your team’s productivity using our AMPS Playbooks, as well as providing holistic account management to your own portfolio of Selling Partners by improving their performance across key metrics.

You must be passionate about managing and developing people, highly analytical, resourceful and customer focused. You need to have a proven track record of delivering results in fast-paced and dynamic business environments while managing the sometimes conflicting needs of different groups of stakeholders.

description:

title: Enterprise Sales Specialist, AWS Connect
description:
DESCRIPTION
As the AWS Connect Specialized Sales Representative, you will have the opportunity to deliver on our strategy to build mind share and adoption of AWS solutions for Connect workloads across AWS’s most strategic customers. You’ll be responsible for the Connect sales motion, which includes; identifying Connect customers & opportunities, qualifying & building pipeline, driving Connect discussions with customers, and responsibility for the overall sales cycle and business goals. By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with these stakeholders, you will be responsible for driving top line revenue growth and overall end customer adoption.

Are you a motivated self-starter with an analytical mind? Do you want to work on the forefront of the latest innovations and technologies? Do you seek the opportunity to work with a diverse set of customers, opportunities and markets as part of a team focused on increasing adoption of Amazon Web Services for Connect?

Come build the future with us

title: Elektriker/Mechatroniker/Industriemechaniker (m/w/d) mit militärischem Hintergrund - Amazon Air
description:
DESCRIPTION
We Pioneer.
Ein Tag, den ersten Schritt zu tun. Ein Tag, sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen. Und heute könnte der Tag sein, an dem Sie selbst Teil einer großen Idee werden. Ein Tag, an dem Sie Ihre eigenen Ideen verwirklichen können. Kommen Sie zu einem Unternehmen, das sich jeden Tag neu erfindet.

Die Einstellung von Personal aus dem Militär ist ein entscheidender Bestandteil unseres unternehmensweiten Business-Plans, die Führungskräfte der Zukunft zu finden. Zudem erleben wir ein schnelles Wachstum in Deutschland und benötigen daher hochqualifizierte Führungskräfte, die mit uns die Grenzen des Möglichen überwinden.

In dieser Position sind Sie für die Instandhaltung und Wartung unserer förder- und haustechnischen Anlagen, sowie Produktionsanlagen in unserem Logistikzentrum zuständig. Hierbei gewährleisten Sie gemeinsam mit dem Technikteam eine hohe Verfügbarkeit der technischen Anlagen durch ein hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative und das nötige technische Know-how.

Ihre Herausforderung:

· Überwachung, Instandhaltung und Wartung unserer förder- und haustechnischen Anlagen und Sicherheitstechnik
· Ausbau bereits bestehender- und Neuinstallation von Elektroanlagen
· Betreuung von automatisierten Produktionsanlagen
· Mitarbeit an technischen Projekten

Freuen Sie sich auf:

· Spannende Aufgaben in einem expandierenden, innovativen und internationalen Umfeld.
· Große Gestaltungsfreiräume für Ihre Ideen und Ihr Engagement.
· Hervorragende Perspektiven aufgrund unseres exzellenten Wachstums.
· Die Mitarbeit in einem kompetenten, hoch motivierten Team.
· Vielfältige Weiterbildungen und ein attraktives Vergütungspaket, das Sie an unserem Unternehmenserfolg beteiligt.

title: Duales Studium / Bachelor of Arts - Fachrichtung: Verkehrsbetriebswirtschaft und Logistik
description:
DESCRIPTION
Wir glauben, dass bei Amazon jeder Tag "Day One" ist.

Ein Tag, den ersten Schritt zu tun. Ein Tag, sich neuen Herausforderungen zu stellen. Und heute könnte der Tag sein, an dem Sie selbst Teil einer großen Idee werden. Ein Tag, an dem Sie Ihre eigenen Ideen verwirklichen können. Kommen Sie zu einem Unternehmen, das sich jeden Tag neu erfindet. Bei Amazon zu arbeiten, ist immer wieder aufregend. Ziel von Amazon ist es seit jeher, das kundenorientierteste Unternehmen der Welt zu werden. Beliefert werden unsere Kunden von unseren Distributionszentren u.a. in Bad Hersfeld, Leipzig, Werne, Graben, Brieselang oder Rheinberg.

Für unseren Standort in Leipzig suchen wir ab dem 01.09.2020 mehrere Studierende (m/w/d) für ein

Duales Studium / Bachelor of Arts
Fachrichtung: Verkehrsbetriebswirtschaft und Logistik
Jobnummer:

Wollen Sie Theorie und Praxis kombinieren und dabei ein echter "Amazonian" werden? Starten Sie als motivierter Abiturient (m/w/d) Ihre Karriere bei Amazon und werden Sie Experte (m/w/d) in Theorie und Praxis an unserem Standort in Leipzig.
Das Studium erstreckt sich über 3 Jahre, mit Theorie- und Praxisphasen und verbindet ein wissenschaftliches Studium mit der beruflichen Praxis bei Amazon. Bei diesem dreijährigen dualen Bachelor-Studium findet die Theorie an der Staatlichen Studienakademie Glauchau statt.

Ziel ist es, nach erfolgreichem Abschluss des Studiums direkt als Nachwuchsführungskraft oder in anderen spannenden Tätigkeitsfeldern, Verantwortung über Prozesse und Mitarbeiter (m/w/d) in unserem Hause zu übernehmen.

Das Aufgabengebiet umfasst:
· Planung, Platzierung und Kontrolle von Gütern, Informationen und Technik sowie Organisation von Personal und Projekten der Lager-, Beschaffungs-, Transport-, Entsorgungs-, Produktions- und Distributionslogistik
· Das Arbeiten in nationalen und internationalen Teams
· Eigenständige Durchführung von Projekten
· Das Erlernen erfolgreicher Mitarbeiterführung in ihren vielfältigen Facetten

title: Solutions Architect - Financial Services
description:
DESCRIPTION
AWS is looking for an experienced Solutions Architect who will be the Trusted Advisor of our Financial Services customers in order to adopt and leverage the value of AWS Platform, ensuring they get the most out of the cloud at every stage of their journey.


In this role, you will serve as a core member of the Worldwide Financial Services Technology team, and play a key role in executing our go-to-market strategy. You will engage with customers to determine business needs, identify opportunities and issues, and develop related technical solutions and value propositions leveraging the power of AWS cloud technology.


You will be able to dive deeply into technical details (e.g. design choices, best practices, use cases) with customer teams and be a key contributor to constructive technical solutions discussions. You will help customers identify both the opportunities and risks with their technical decisions. You will take part in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).

title: Content Program Manager, Prime Video, m/f/d
description:
DESCRIPTION
Please submit your application in English

Are you interested in shaping the future of movies and television? Do you want to define the next generation of how and what Amazon customers are watching? Prime Video is one of the leading digital video services on the Internet today, and we’re just getting started changing the way millions of people around the world enjoy content. Now available in more than 240 countries and territories, Prime Video offers customers the broadest selection of any on-demand video service, including our critically-acclaimed Amazon Originals Series such as the multi-award-winning The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, Tom Clancy’s Jack Ryan, The Boys; Amazon Original hit series made in Germany like BEAT, Bibi & Tina, Deutschland89, Inside Borussia Dortmund, Pastewka, You Are Wanted, the forthcoming drama series Wir Kinder vom Bahnhof Zoo and the comedy show LOL: Last One Laughing; exclusive TV shows like Star Trek: Picard, American Gods and Vikings; and movies like Late Night and I Am Your Woman, plus live concerts and live sports including UEFA Champions League football.

Amazon Studios is the movies and television development and production arm of Amazon. It is our role to produce original content and license studio programs worldwide in exclusive service of Amazon’s Prime Video customers. We need your passion, innovative ideas, and creativity to help take us to new heights.


Amazon Prime Video team is looking for an analytical and creative candidate to join our content licensing team as a Content Program Manager. The Program Manager provides supports for our global licensing efforts and is responsible for managing our contractual rights and partner relationships outside of deal negotiation. They will liaise with other Amazon digital video teams within Amazon (catalog operations, marketing, etc.) to manage the execution of our content license agreements. Additionally, the Program Manager will support the larger content licensing team on content insight analysis and ad hoc data requests.

Specific responsibilities include:
· Turn content license agreements into standardized metadata for internal consumption.
· Manage title schedules and communicate key dates to stakeholders.
· Partner with content acquisition managers throughout the deal negotiation process. Ensuring we are securing the best content for our Prime Video customers under the most beneficial terms.
· Respond to partner payment inquiries, working with accounts payable to resolve.
· Performance reporting and content insight analysis; analyze performance results to drive improvements in acquisitions strategy.
· Identify opportunities to streamline, automate and scale processes.

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Labor Planning
description:
DESCRIPTION
Amazon opened its virtual doors in 1995 and strives to be the world’s most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything they might want to buy online.

The role will be based in DE and some travel will be required.

This role is all about making Amazon Transportation Services the best it can be. So, it’s analysing and reporting on our daily, weekly and monthly operational, service, productivity and customer experience metrics.

You will use your intuition and data analysis skills to spot trends and opportunities to more effectively prepare workforce planning and reduce costs, while boosting performance.

Your role will also be to provide new analytical insight into issues we have, whilst suggesting mitigating actions to address adverse trends.

You will report to the Production Control Manager and you’ll work with our Business Partners to support all operational targets and get involved in our strategic operational planning. This means mining complex data warehouses and making sure all of your analyses are accurate, timely and completed to a very high standard.

However, you won’t stop there. Casting a critical eye over your own work, you’ll streamline our processes, improve operational efficiency, customer service and operational compliance.

You’ll also influence UK/EU-wide financial planning and analysis projects, you’ll work with senior-level staff closer to home. So you’ll have every chance to make a name for yourself on a national and international scale.

title: Sr Software Development Engineer
description:
DESCRIPTION
As an organization, we believe in making a big difference in people’s lives. We do so by building ground technology that enables innovation to solve complex challenges. We engineer pioneering virtualization software that serves as the foundation to driving innovation efficiently, and nimbly. We influence the different layers of the stack, while attentively listening to customer input.

EC2 Accelerated Nitro is the organization that drives the engineering parts of the EC2 Accelerated Computing business, and that crafts and releases the hypervisors that power the EC2 Nitro fleet. We build highly operable quiescent software that provides near bare metal performance to EC2 instances. We also integrate hardware accelerators (GPUs, FPGAs, etc.) into the EC2 instance families to support advanced workloads, such as machine learning, high performance computing, inference or graphics processing.

EC2 Accelerated Nitro is looking for a Software Development Engineer to work on the system software at the core of EC2, the AWS service that provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud. You will have the chance to make a significant impact on our systems, our business and, most importantly, our customers.

With good software engineering knowledge, and interest to grow in the virtualization space, you will partner up with expert engineers of the field, and make a real difference in the world, building solutions to challenging problems that affect millions of people.

title: Global Cloud Inftrastructure Architect
description:
DESCRIPTION
As a Cloud Consultant you will help customers and partners use cloud computing web services to do new things bigger, faster and at lower cost, developing technical expertise and capacity, while collaborating with them on key engagements.
You will deliver proof-of-concept projects and topical workshops, managing your projects effectively while delivering as part of larger teams. You will work with customers and partners internalizing their context while using your business and technical skills to design solutions based on requirements and constraints.
You will work on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high impact projects using the newest cloud technology, gaining the deepest customer and partner insights to maximize the value of cloud computing technologies.
You will own and complete key tasks and deliverables, and collaborate with others to define and implement optimal, complete solutions based on stakeholders needs. You will work towards customer business outcomes, ensuring there is a strong connection between delivery activities and business objectives. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery
Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact?
Come build the future with us.

title: DevOps Consultant
description:
DESCRIPTION
As a DevOps Consultant at AWS, you will help our partners develop technical expertise and capacity, while also collaborating with our customers and partners on key engagements. You will deliver proof-of-concept projects, topical workshops, and lead implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on key customer solutions such as, web applications, enterprise applications, HPC, batch processing and big data, archiving and disaster recovery, education and government.

You will collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS services in key market verticals and lead them through large organizational and SDLC transformations. Engagements will include migration of existing applications and development of new applications using AWS cloud services. You will work with AWS engineering, support and business teams to convey partner and customer feedback as input to AWS technology roadmaps.

Do you look around corners for ways to engage and service customers? Are you passionate about using technology to solve business problems that have big customer impact?

Come build the future with us.

title: Teamleiter/-in Logistik (m/wd)
description:
DESCRIPTION
Unser Amazon Operations Team wächst! Wenn Du Teil eines Unternehmens werden möchtest, wo du etwas Bedeutendes bewegen kannst, Spaß hast, Erfolge feierst und ein Lächeln auf die Gesichter unserer Kunden zauberst, dann ist diese Stelle die richtige für Dich!
Du bist für die fachliche Führung des operativen Teams verantwortlich und spielst eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Bearbeitung unserer Kundenaufträge. Du arbeitest eng mit deinem Team auf der Fläche zusammen, um für reibungslose operative Abläufe an unseren Logistikstandorten zu sorgen. Dazu zählen unsere Logistikzentren, wo die Ware auf Kundenbestellungen wartet, unsere Sortierzentren, die Pakete für die weitere Verteilung an die Zustellungsdienste sortieren, sowie unsere Verteilzentren die für die letzten Kilometer bis zur Haustür des Kunden zuständig sind.

Wir möchten, dass unsere Teams zusammenarbeiten, Dinge voranbringen, und sich nicht mit dem Status quo zufriedengeben. Jeder Tag ist bei uns anders, was stets für neue Herausforderungen und Abwechslung sorgt!

Du wirst…

- Darauf achten, dass Sicherheitsstandards eingehalten werden und stets auf dem neusten Stand sind und damit eine sichere Arbeitsumgebung schaffen.
- Die Aufgaben während deiner Schichten verteilen und anpassen und in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Schichtleiterteam erste Führungsaufgaben übernehmen.
- Unsere Teams motivieren und schulen.
- Sicherstellen, dass Kundenbestellungen gemäß unseren Qualitäts- und Sicherheitsstandards bearbeitet werden.
- Durchgängig relevante Informationen und Kennzahlen auswerten und an das Management-Team weitergeben.
- Stunden- und Zeitplänen für die Mitarbeiterteams erstellen.
- Mit internen und externen Kollegen (m/w/d) zusammenarbeiten (z.B. aus dem Bereich HR, Customer Service, Transport).
- Prozesse auswerten, optimieren und Innovationen vorantreiben.

title: Third Party (3P) Business Development Manager (m/w/d)
description:
DESCRIPTION
At Amazon, we're working to be the most Customer-centric company on earth. One customer experience that we are constantly looking to take to a new level is how we fulfill and deliver orders. Our goal is to exceed the expectations of all our customers by ensuring that their orders, no matter how large or small are delivered where and when they need them, as quickly, accurately, and cost effectively as possible. To meet this goal, Amazon is continually striving to innovate and provide best in class service levels through the introduction of pioneering new products and services in the last mile delivery space. Come build the future with us!

We are looking for a Business Development manager who will be responsible for sourcing, vetting and securing Delivery Service Partners (DSPs) as part of a new growth program. The program gives entrepreneurs an opportunity to develop a successful package delivery business with low startup costs and access to Amazon's technology and logistics experience.
This role supports the EU operation and requires the availability to travel based on business need.

Key functions for the role include:
· Development of national partnerships across Germany in the small business owner, entrepreneurship, and under-represented business owner communities.
· Ownership of the overall Delivery Service Partner leads marketing, acquisition, recruiting and vetting.
· Working with Program and Product teams to create and improve new tech tools to enable a more efficient acquisition and tracking of DSPs.
· Working with Operations and central planning teams to determine current and future DSP needs, building a pipeline of high quality candidates to support as opportunities are available.
· Presenting our overall DSP program in front of groups, large and small, including a strong ability to answer complex questions on the fly. Strong candidates will have an expert ability to translate abstract concepts into audience appropriate statements.

description:
DESCRIPTION
